loans.name: Dúo Rositas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Rositas de San Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Julia Felisa, ella tiene 40 años de edad, y dos hijos varones, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de abarrotes, tales como aguas gaseosas, golosinas, cereales, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, jabón, detergente, etc. Así como su venta de refacción en la escuela nacional, ella está solicitando el Crédito para la inversión de su venta de ya que con el capital que trabaja no le es suficiente para surtir su tiendas su propósito es seguir invirtiendo y seguir creciendo su negocio y sobre todo que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando y que no les falte nada.esta solicitando el credito para la compra de productos comestibles.
texts.en: Julia Felisa is one of the duo called Rositas de San Bartolo. She is 40 years old and has two sons. She sells groceries, such as carbonated water, sweets, cereals, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, soap and detergent, etc. She also sells snacks in the national school. She is requesting the loan to invest in stock as the working capital she has at present is not enough to stock the shops. Her aim is to continue investing in and growing her business, and especially that her two sons continue studying and that they have everything they need. She is requesting the loan to buy food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Clavinga Group

texts.en:
Donald is a member of Clavinga Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, 8 women and 3 men. Donald is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Donald first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Donald joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Donald reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 1/2 a bag of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 8 bags per 1/2 acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to buy a piece of land and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Donald’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: Waly est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce deux activités, l'agriculture et l'élevage.L'agriculture lui permet d'avoir du mil et de l'arachide pour la consommation et l'élevage lui rapporte des revenus pour la prise en charge des divers besoins de la famille.En effet, il achète chaque année des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend sur le marché local. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 600 000f pour acheter des boeufs.Son ambition est de construire un grand enclos en dur.
texts.en: Waly is a married man and the father of 3 children. He is engaged in 2 types of activities, farming and breeding. The farming allows him to have millet and groundnuts for consumption and the breeding generates an income which is used to take care of the family's various needs. Each year, he buys cattle which he fattens and sells at the local market. In order to increase his business, he is requesting a loan of 600 000 francs so that he can buy cattle. He aims to build a large, paved holding pen.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris has a general store, and she has devoted herself to this business activity for over 2 years. According to Peris, she has a very good clientele. This is because she has all types of products, and this is what the people look for nowadays.

She is very enterprising, and she says she really likes to help the people most in need. Her objective is to enlarge her place. This way she will be a source of work for more people.

She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, milk, and other products. She will do this in order to be able to stock her store and to continue offering her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is from Kisauni. She makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. She is a widow and has two children who attend school. Florence lives with her children in their own house. Florence is a very hardworking woman with very good references. She has been working in this business for 6 years.

Florence is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing, since the valentine season is upon her and she wants to offer a better variety of clothing to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin says that he benefited from the previous loans by increasing his business capital to buy maize flour and many other items.  He is now taking another loan to buy more flour and other items, and he says that he is happy for the loans.

loans.use: to purchase more items like maize flour, wheat flour and many others.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandmother and sister). She has a business of selling second hand shoes and has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes.  

She has been selling used shoes for five years and works six days out of every week, selling to all categories of people, but on a retail basis only. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include rent and seasonality.  

Annet is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Bahati Group

texts.en:
Jane is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Bahati Group members. The 11 of them, 7 women and 4 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Jane first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jane joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer in order to grow enough food for the family.

Jane, as a One Acre Fund farmer, described her harvest as excellent last year and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and also to invest in cows. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Jane’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (her mother). Her business is a shop where she sells to all categories of people on a retail basis only.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.  She generates additional income through farming.  

Gertrude works in her shop seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine for his sick mother.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 41 years old and is from the Sachkhere District in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, his two children and his parents. His father works as a guard at a local hospital. Vakhtang requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Vakhtang is a driver. He transports local passengers by bus and gets a monthly income. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vakhtang requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan programs envisage the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor that do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Vakhtang will purchase his own bus. After purchasing a bus he will continue working as a driver and increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a bus.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with two children, and both of them go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  Her business is a retail shop, and she has been in this business for seven years.  She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and a bag of rice.

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Dina Liliana

texts.es:
Dina, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y tienen tres hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Dina, lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo de granos básicos pero ha visto que con el café le va mejor. Ahora solo cultiva café. La producción la vende a los intermediarios de la zona. Ella ha invertido varios prestamos en su finca, el préstamo que ha solicitado actualmente es el numero 16, el cual es por 18,000 lempiras y lo va utilizar para comprar varios sacos de abono y fertilizante para darle mantenimiento a su finca y también va sembrar 1/2 manzana mas de café. Espera sacar mejor producción en el año. Su plan es mejorar la finca, ampliar la producción para poder mejorar la situación familiar.
texts.en:
Dina, age 31, lives in a common-law marriage.  They have three children, and they live in a village in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Dina has been farming for 15 years.  She used to grow basic grains, but she has seen that growing coffee goes better for her.  She now only grows coffee.  She sells the production to intermediaries in the area.

She has invested several loans in her farm.  The loan she has now requested is number 16, and it is for 18,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance to her farm.  She will also plant one half of a ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] more of coffee.

She hopes to get better production this year.  Her plan is to improve her farm and to expand production in order to be able to improve her family situation.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer and to plant one half of a ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] more of coffee.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is taking out another Kiva loan. Thanks to her effort and hard work her business has expanded. She now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service she provides her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her clothes-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Laurina

texts.en:
Laurina is 34 years old and lives in Magibi county which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She has two children aged 2 and 8 years old. They are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a electrician. 

For the past four years she has been selling charcoal in the market, and through her business she has gained respect in her community and also is a mother of a supportive home. One of the problems she is facing is that the rainy season delays her supply. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: El Hadji Hamady

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji Hamady est un jeune cultivateur, âgé de 37 ans qui a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine d’activité. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont  l’ainé a 6 ans et un bébé de 2 mois.
Avec le crédit, il désire acheter des semences et exploiter son espace cultural. Avec  les bénéfices de son activité, il va améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
 Il désire s’il a un fond beaucoup plus consistant, ouvrir une ferme agricole.
texts.en: El Hadji Hamady is a young, 37-year-old farmer with 2 years experience in farming. He is married and the father of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 6 and the youngest of whom is a 2-month old baby. With this loan, he would like to buy seeds and cultivate his arable land. He will use the profits from his business to improve his family's nutrition. He would like to start a farm, should he have more consistent revenues.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cultivate his arable land.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is taking out another Kiva loan to pay school fees for her school-going child. With effort and dedication she is struggling to get ahead and ensuring that her children get better education.

She is requesting a loan to pay her school costs. Zulekha is grateful for this loan because it will help her child attend school.

loans.use: to pay her child's school costs.

loans.name: Susuanna

texts.en:
Susuanna is single, 26 years old, and lives at Air Port area in Magibi county, the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her boyfriend and three children between the ages of 1 and 13. Two of her children are in school.

For five years now she has been selling used clothes in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and learned this way of selling from her mother. The problem she faces is the rainy season.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata, âgé de 46 ans, est une vendeuse de couscous avéré. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans et a choisi le métier par amour. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’ainé a 17 ans et le cadet 3 ans. Fatoumata est a son 1er crédit à l’IMCEC et désire augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant du mil, du mais qui entre dans la préparation du couscous. 
Il souhaite dans l’avenir acheter une maison pour mettre à l’aise sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata is 46 years old. She is married with six children aged 3 to 17. She sells authentic couscous, and she has ten years of experience in this activity chosen out of love. 

This is her first loan cycle with IMCEC, and she will use the credit to bolster her stock of supplies. She will buy millet and maize, which she uses to prepare couscous. 

In the future, she wants to buy a house where her family would live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy millet and maize to make couscous to sell.

loans.name: Gpf Pelital Group

texts.fr:
Habitant le même quartier, elles se sont formées en groupe de crédit  pour pouvoir avoir accès aux crédits proposés aux groupements. Elles sont au nombre de 4 et porte le nom de GPF PELITAL. Elles font du commerce, et leur présidente la dame Youma, a acquis une expérience de plus de 25 ans dans son métier. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé 27 ans et le plus jeune, 7 ans. Avec le crédit, elle pourra acheter divers variétés de  tissus et les revendre dans le voisinage.
 Elle appui son mari dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle désire ouvrir une ferme agricole si elle voit son capital augmenté.
texts.en: Living in the same district, these women formed a loan group so that they could have access to loans offered to groups. The group is made up of 4 women and is called "Gpf Pelital". The women are retailers and their leader, Youma, has over 25 years experience in her line of work. She is married and the mother of 8 children, the eldest of whom is 27 years old and the youngest, 7. With this loan, she will be able to buy various types of fabric and resell it in the neighbourhood. She supports her husband with the household's daily expenditures. If her capital increases, she would like to start a farm.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposo, y uno de los hijos. Ella tiene 10 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa americana clasificada (ropa de segunda mano), su venta la realiza de manera ambulante en su zona y a sus alrededores. La ropa es usada pero clasificada, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, camisetas y ropa interior. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente tenia una pulpería y también vendía mercadería.  Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa para surtir y aprovechar cumplir con los compromisos que tiene pendientes. Su meta a futuro es llegar a tener un local fijo y establecer bien su negocio en un lugar céntrico a la ciudad. Se muestra agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia.
texts.en:
Erlinda, age 56, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and one of their children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

She has been selling second-hand American clothes for ten years.  She sells in an itinerant manner in her area and in the surrounding areas.  She sells used clothes like blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, t-shirts, and underwear.  She has always worked in commerce.  She previously had a grocery store, and she also sold merchandise.

She has decided to request a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy clothes to stock up.  She will also use it to fill pending orders that she has.

Her goal for the future is to come to have a fixed location.  She wants to well establish her business in a spot that is in the center of the city.  She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for stock and to fill pending orders.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as humble and God-fearing. 

He operates a retail store where he sells products such as soda, eggs, tissue, margarine, tea leaves sachet, confectioneries, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located near a school, and his primary customers are students, teachers and daily consumers from the area. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy items to resell. Chrispine plans to  add to his business income by selling snacks to customers. His business goal is to expand his business so as to create job opportunities for people within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business and the living standard of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase items to resell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives at the Airport community in Magibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is single and has two children, 12 and 14 years old.

Since 1990 she has been selling red oil in the local market. She likes how people respond to her business and really enjoys the interaction with her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for the business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is taking out another Kiva loan. She is a person who very much wants to move forward, which is why she wants to provide her children with better education. 

She’s asking for the loan to buy her children school supplies so they are able to continue studying and do well in school. She thanks Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy her children school supplies.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is widowed with six children, and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandsons). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years.

She has applied for a loan of 1700000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She sells both on wholesale and retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of bags of charcoal. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to buy more plots so as to build rental houses. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes electricity and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
Yobana de 30 años , casada con Emiliano de 43 años y madre de 3 niños. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble que construyo con el apoyo de su esposo.
Al cumplir la mayoría de edad heredó unas parcelas por parte de sus abuelos , lugar que le sirve como sustento para mantener a su familia .Lleva casi 12 años de trabajo actividades que realiza  con el apoyo de su esposo .
Comenta que le agrada su labor puesto que le permite tener la participación integral de su familia, no obstante la temporada de lluvias es un gran inconveniente para el normal desempeño de sus labores.
Con el pasar de los años ha notado que sus suelos requieren ser reforzados para optimizar su producción para el cual desea adquirir sacos con abono orgánico y obtener mazorcas de calidad.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes para así generar más ingreso paralelo a su trabajo en el campo.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, agradecida por la oportunidad brindada se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas . En esta primera ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y asi optimizar la calidad de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Yobana is 30 years old, is married to Emiliano, aged 43, and has three children. She lives in a home built using good-quality materials, which she built with the help of her husband.

When she reached adulthood, she inherited some plots of land from her grandparents, which she now farms to support her family. She has worked for nearly 12 years, supported by her husband. She explains that she likes her work, because it allows her to play a key role in providing for her family. However, the rainy season is a big hindrance to the normal performance of her work.

Over time, she has noticed that her land requires additional help to optimize yield, which is why she wants to buy bags of organic fertilizer and grow superior crops. In the future, she plans to open a permanent business in the form of a grocery store, in order to increase her earnings in addition to her work in the countryside. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her repayments on time. For this first time, she wants 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer and in this way, maximize the quality of her fruit.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Noura Group

texts.en:
This group, called Noura, is made up of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They got together with the idea of helping their families. 

Jwahr is one of the members. She is 30 years old. She is a married woman and has four children. She says that she puts a lot of effort into helping her family. 

She has a business selling different types of cosmetics. She faces challenges in her business, so she applied for a youth loan of 15,000 YER from AMB to buy additional types of cosmetics. She wants to be well-stocked so that she can offer a good variety of products to her customers.

She will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional types of cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Savalu Group

texts.en:
Lydia is a member of the Savalu Group in the Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 31 One Acre Fund farmers - 17 women and 14 men. Lydia is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Lydia is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school

Lydia managed to harvest 16 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to invest in buying a cow and save for the future. 

Lydia’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 15.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Sankey

texts.en:
Sankey lives in the Airport community in Magibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 39 years old and married with four children between 9 and 18 years old. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. 

For the past five years, she has been selling body cream, blouses, body powder, etc. in the local market. Sankey says she spends most of her time with her business since it helps to sustain the family. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. At the time her husband was not working, but currently her husband works with Firestone. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, blouse, body powder, etc. for her business.

She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy body cream, blouses, and body powder for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of drinks (juices, beer).

loans.name: Yulisa

texts.es:
Yulisa de 28 años  esta casada con Anatolio de 37 años y junto a él tienen 2 niños . Actualmente tienen una  vivienda construida a base de material noble . Se dedica integralmente a las actividades productivas consistentes en el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico en su localidad.
Lleva casi 13 años desempeñándose de manera independiente y ha logrado hasta el momento consolidar su labor y dar asi sustento a su familia.Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que puede contar con el apoyo de Anatolio con quien viene realizando las tareas rutinarias de deshierbo, deschuponado, entre otros.
A manera de incrementar la productividad de sus parcelas  desea realizar una remolición de sus suelos e incrementar su producción, asimismo desea contar con plantas de almácigo para reemplazar plantaciones antiguas.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la adquisición de más terrenos para dedicarlos a la producción de café orgánico y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia.
Esta es su primera experiencia con MFP, para el cual se muestra muy agradecida y a la vez comprometida para cumplir de manera puntual con el pago de sus cuotas razon por la cual desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantaciones de almácigo y reemplazar sus plantaciones antiguas.
texts.en:
Yulisa is 28 years old, married to Anatolio, aged 37, and has two children with him. They live in a home made from good-quality materials. She makes a living in productive activites, which involve looking after and producing organic cocoa in her area. 

She has been in this business on a self-employed basis for nearly 13 years, and until now has managed to consolidate her work and support her family in through this. She really enjoys her job since she is supported by Anatolio, with whom she carries out daily activities such as weeding and suckering.
In order to increase the productivity of her land, she wants to churn up the earth and increase yield. She also wants new plants to replace old plantations. 

Her long-term aims are to buy more land to produce organic coffee, in this way increasing her earnings to benefit her family. 

This is her first experience with MFP. She is very grateful and committed to making her loan repayments on time. She wants 1,000 to buy soles to buy new plants to replace her old plantations.

loans.use: to buy new plants.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old. She lives in the Airport community of Magibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She stopped her education at 6th grade, and she is married with two children ages 6 and 10 years old. They are living with her and going to school. 

For the past ten years, she been selling used clothes in the market. The problem that she is facing is the rainy season. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. 

Her plans are to send her children to college and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of 34 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Jane. The group has 26 women and 8 men. Jane is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant one half acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Jane is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Last year, Jane harvested three bags of maize on one acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to help the neighbors who are in need with food and also create awareness to those who are eager to join OAF. Jane’s group members will each receive input loans of one half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 17 acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Magibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is 50 years of age. She stopped her education at second grade. She is married and has four children who live at home and attend school. Her husband is a sanitation leader. 

For the past 20 years, she been baking and selling bread in her community and around town. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the business because of the experiences she has every day.

Her plans is to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, and baking powder to expand her business. She hopes to build a store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, and baking powder to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Marta es una madre muy trabajadora y esforzada tiene a cargo su hija y su nieta, por lo cual se esfuerza mucho en mantener su negociom en las mejores condiciones, ella se dedica a ventas por catálogo a domicilio, trata de satisfacer los pedidos de sus compradores para aumentar la clientela, ella necesita un crédito de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (¢350.000) para comprar productos y tener nueva  mercadería que ofrecer. Su propósito es  extenderse a otras zonas para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Marta is a very hard-working and dedicated mother, who looks after her daughter and her niece. For this reason, she works really hard to keep her business in good working order. She is a door-to-door seller of products in catalogs. She tries to satisfy her customers' orders to increase her client base. She needs a loan of three hundred and fifty thousand colones (¢350.000) to buy products and offer new merchandize. Her goal is to offer her products in other places to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to sell catalog products.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married and has four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family (her sister). She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. She generates additional income selling piped water and juice.

She has a business of selling Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells on both a wholesale and a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to sell wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy decorative and piñata items.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred is 43 years old and lives in in Magibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is married and she has six children between 16 to 28 years old. All of them are currently in school and only three live at home.

For the past three years she has been running a local restaurant in the market. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, dry fish, pepper, vita (a soft drink), and dried meat for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, dry fish, pepper, vita, and dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.es:
Renilda de 26 años reside con su esposo Alejandro de 35 años y juntos tienen una niña de 5 años , ambos coomparten una vivienda construida a base de Material noble que ocupan en calidad de alquiler. 
Desde muy pequeña tuvo presencia activa apoyando a sus padres en labores productivas ,con el pasar de los años optó por convertir este en su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia , junto a Alejandro con quien labora en el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico.
Comenta que le agrada su trabajo puesto que no está ligado a presiones de horario y es una labor que puede desempeñar en conjunto con su familia pero por encontrarse en la temporada de lluvias han visto por conveniente adelantar el segundo deshierbo de campaña para asi evitar que la mala hierba compita por los nutrientes con sus plantaciones de cacao razón por la  cual desean contar con obreros para asi realizar con mayor rapidez el trabajo.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la compra de un vehículo para el transporte de los granos secos desde sus parcelas hasta la ciudad y expenderlos a los centros de acopio mas cercanos ,puesto que transportarlos de manera particular incrementa su costo de producción final. 
Este es su primer préstamo otorgado por MFP, se siente agradecida y a la vez muy contenta por la oportunidad brindada considerándolo una gran herramienta de trabajo , indispensable para desempeñar su labor de manera fluida.
En esta primera oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la contrata de obreros y proceder con el segundo deshierbo de campaña productiva  para optimizar la producción final.
texts.en:
Renilda, 26, lives with her husband Alejandro, 35, and together they have a daughter, 5.  They share a house built of solid materials, which they rent.

She had an active presence helping her parents in agricultural labor ince she was very young.  In time she decided to turn this into her main source of income for her family, along with Alejandro, who produces organic cacao.

She says she likes her job because she's not tied to schedule pressures and because it's a job she can do with her family.  Because it's the rainy season, though, she sees the need to go ahead with the second weeding of the season so the weeds don't compete with the nutrients on her farm.  This is why she wants to hire laborers to do the job faster.

Her plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to transport the dried beans from her land to the city to dispense to the closest distribution center, because transporting them personally increases the final production cost.

This is her first loan from MFP.  She's grateful for and also very happy about this opportunity, which she considers a great working tool that's indispensable for doing her job fluidly.

This first time, she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to hire workers and continue with the second weeding of the growing season to make the most of the final crop.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 51 años está casado con Doris. Ellos tienen 3 hijos, quienes viven con ellos en una casa propia, que Juan construyó hace muchos años.
Juan es un hombre trabajador. Su actividad principal es la agricultura. Posee como 3 hectáreas de cultivos, donde produce tubérculos como papas, hortalizas como arvejas, y otros como lechugas, coles, alfalfa, etc. “El secreto es sembrar de todo, en cada fecha del año, para que no falten ingresos en todo el año”, menciona.
Gracias a su arduo trabajo, Juan ha conseguido comprar varios terrenos, en uno de ellos construyo su casa y en los otros produce los alimentos.
Cuenta con 2 toros los que le sirven para arar la tierra y los que también alquila a otros agricultores. Así obtiene más ingresos.
Ahora se encuentra preparando un terreno para sembrar avena, cebada y maíz. Por ello requiere de su ayuda.
Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se muestra agradecido por el apoyo anterior. Pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y es un socio responsable en las actividades y puntual en los pagos.
Invertirá los 500 soles solicitados en la compra de abono orgánico, para diversos cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, 51, is married to Doris. They have three children that live with them in their own house, built by Juan many years ago.

Juan is a hardworking man who works in agriculture. He grows different crops in three hectares he owns, such as potatoes, green peas, lettuce, cabbage and alfalfa. “The secret is to grow all kinds of things, in different seasons, in order to have a stable income,” he says.

Thanks to his hard work, Juan has managed to buy several pieces of land; he built his house in one of them and grows food in the remaining ones. He also has two oxen that help him to plow the land; by renting them to other farmers, he receives an additional income. Juan is now preparing the land to grow oat, barley and corn and that is why he requires help.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. He appreciates all the support he has received. He is a member of the communal bank “Señor de Muruhay.” He is responsible and on time with his payments.

Juan will use the 500 soles [PEN] to buy compost for his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old, married, with children who are all schooling. Due lack of tuition, Samuel dropped out of school and started farming on a small scale as a way of earning some money and looking after himself. He is also currently into the produce trade as another source of income to cater to the family.

Samuel wants a loan of UGX 700,000/= (seven hundred thousand shillings) to buy cassava for grinding into flour since it's now a dry season. This will enable him to earn more profits and be in position to cater to the family's needs. 

His dream is to grow the agricultural business on a larger scale by acquiring more land. However, Samuel has the challenge of the changing weather conditions that affect the business and the transport, as well.

loans.use: to buy cassava for grinding into flour and then selling.

loans.name: Benentta

texts.en:
Benentta is 44 years old and lives in the Airport community. She stopped her education at grade 3, but she is good at managing her business. She has five children aged between 7 and 23 years old, three of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband is a teacher.

For the past 20 years Benentta has been selling cold drinks such as soda and soft drinks to sustain herself and her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soda and soft drinks for her business.

Her plans are to build a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soda and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Maritza Teresa

texts.es: Maritza , tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en una colonia suburbana de san Pedro sula.  Maritza estuvo trabajando en una maquila y cuando quedo sin trabajo decidió dedicarse a su propia actividad de negocio. Hace dos que inicio vendiendo ropa usada como blusas, camisetas, faldas, pantalones y pantalones cortos. La ropa la vende de manera ambulante. Ella tuvo gastos de útiles escolares con su hijo y se descapitalizo, ahora ha solicitado un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa y surtir para continuar su negocio y cumplir con los encargos que tiene de sus clientes. Su sueño en llegar a tener su negocio establecido en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 30, is married and has one child.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

She was working at a factory.  When she was left without a job she decided to work at her own business activity.  Two years ago she started selling used clothes like blouses, t-shirts, skirts, pants, and shorts.  She sells the clothes in an itinerant manner.

She had expenses for her child’s school supplies, and she was left without capital.  She has now requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and stock up.  She will do this in order to continue with her business and to fill customer orders that she has.

Her dream is to establish her business in a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to stock her business and to sell.

loans.name: Margert

texts.en: Margert lives in Magibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 34 years old and married with two children, ages 2  and 10 years old that are in school and live at home. For the past 8 years Margert has been selling fresh fish, chicken and pig's feet in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. The challenge she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish, chicken and pig's feet for her business. She wants to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish, chicken and pig's feet for her business

loans.name: Kou

texts.en: Kou, a 34-year-old single mother of four schoolchildren ranging in age from 2 to 14 years, lives in Magibi county, which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. For the past ten years Kou has been selling rice, cookies, flour, sugar, etc. in the local market, enjoying a large customer base and good profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of the above items for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cookies, flour, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and lives Magibi county, which includes the greatest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She’s married and has two children, ages 19 and 21. The are attending school and they live at home. Mary's husband is a security man.

For the past ten years, Mary has been in to charcoal business. She enjoys the buying because she makes a lot of profit. Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a house for her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Samira Group

texts.en: This group is called Samira and consists of 4 members. They live in Hodeida, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Nadia is 25 years old and is the president of the group. She is a tailor who offers good services for her clients. She has been doing this for 5 years. She says that she began with a small tailoring machine. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead.  Nadia is asking for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase ladies' fabrics in order to be able to continue her business. She is working toward increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land to expand his ginger growing

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 21 years old and lives in Magibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single and has two children, ages 1 and 4 years old; the oldest one is in school and they all live at home. Oretha is a 9th grade student and she has been selling rice, oil and pepper in the local market for four years now. She enjoys her business because she makes lots of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Union Magisterio Group

texts.en:
Ragina, shown above on the left in the black shirt, is a 44-year-old mother of three children, ages 21, 17 and 6. The two younger children live at home with her and attend school. For the past three years Ragina has been operating her kiosk at a local school where she sells ice cream, soft drinks and candy to students. She will use this loan to buy more items for her kiosk including ice cream, soft drinks and various small food items.

Regina is also an artisan who produces handmade crafts. Her dream is to someday sell these products out of her home in order to supplement her income during the summer vacation when the school is closed.

Regina enjoys the support she has received as a borrower of local MFI, Fondo Esperanza. She says the weekly meetings that she is required to attend have been very useful and have taught her a lot. She has learned to run her business more efficiently and appreciates the importance of equality for women.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell at her kiosk such as ice cream, candy and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a one of the members with a housing loan from the city of Samana. This is her 11th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her food-selling business for over five years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. With her last loan, she invested in her business, where she sells food.

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients, who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house, at the same time running their business and attending their group meetings.

Adriana is a single woman. She works and lives in a rural town in Samana. She will use this loan to buy cement and other construction materials to finish building her roof and the wall coating. She thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other construction materials to finish the roof and wall coating of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory to increase sales.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1.1 Group

texts.en:
Elupina is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost two years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Fe y Esperanza 1.1 (Faith and Hope) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received five loans to invest in her business. Esperanza International is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their homes while running their businesses and attending groups meetings. 

Elupina is living in a rural town with her long term partner and her only child. She started building her house with their family savings and her business profits. She took out loans with Esperanza almost three years ago to expand her business selling clothes. Elupina will finish building the floor for her house while the other member, Jimena, will build her house roof. Both members request a housing loan for their home improvement.

Elupina and Jimena thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house floor and roof.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 31-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working as a mechanic since 2007. Adnan is a hard worker and well known in his region for his special work and experience.

Adnan is applying for his third loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary motor oils to support his business. His previous loans helped him in improving and developing his social and financial life and reflected positively on his business development.

He also works in selling and maintaining power generators and trading cars. He hopes to keep on improving his business and expanding his working zone.

loans.use: to buy necessary motor oils to support his business.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is married and works hard to support her family.
She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Virgincita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her livestock.

Virgincita has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for pets, pet shop accessories and merchandise items needed in her business.

loans.name: Edrina

texts.en:
Edrina is 66 years old and widowed with five children.

Edrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and has rental houses in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Edrina has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.
Edrina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Clarita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build and expand her business.
NWTF is relisting Clarita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nicetas

texts.en: Nicetas dreams of lifting her family out of poverty. She is 53 years old. She operates a small store in front of their house where she sells a variety of products. Sometimes she also sells cooked food. She has been in this business for 3 years and usually earns 300 PHP a day which is used for food and allowances. Nicetas business needs additional products to sell in order to increase profits. Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory in order to expand the store's inventory.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 30-year-old single man who has been working in selling distilled drinking water since 2011. This is Hassan's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He is applying for a youth loan in order to buy empty plastic water bottles to increase business capital. This loan will help him deal with the unexpected increase in customers. Hassan is very happy with what he has achieved and he is working hard to keep on developing his business as much as he can. However, he can't do it on his own. That is why he requested external support from Al Majmoua and he is sure that it will have a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: to buy empty plastic water bottles to increase business capital.

loans.name: Cielito

texts.en: Cielito's business is sari-sari store. She has been doing this for three years. She earns about PHP 300 a day. Cielito is 52 years old and is married with three children. She raised her children with the earnings from her business, that's why she wants to expand it. Right now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, bread and condiments to sell. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, bread and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase different types of clothing. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy different types of clothing for children, men and women. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jonathan dreams to give his family a good future and hopes that his business will continue to grow. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothes for his business.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of a single child. She resides with her family in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, Chim has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years with the support of her partner. Chim’s desire is to elevate her living standard, secure the overall welfare of her family and provide good opportunities to her only child. Aside from the hardships she has experienced in farming, Chim also uses her time to sell items, selling boiled eggs, especially for some religious festivals in her neighborhood or in local pagodas of the province. This enables her to have extra profits to cover her daily needs.

At this time, Chim is asking for a loan of USD 700 to use to cover traveling expenses for her and her husband who are planning to work in Thailand, where they believe that they can earn more income than what they do their own country. However, this couple will return back to work at their paddy fields when the rainy season arrives. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she and her husband will further improve their living status.

loans.use: to cover traveling expenses for her and her husband for planned work in Thailand.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 63-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. Her youngest is still in college. At her age, she is working as hard as she can to provide income for her everyday needs and to help her family as well.

Benita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue her business she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benita dreams of expanding her business and having her own stall. She hopes for good health and a strong body. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Violate is 36 years old and single.
Violate works hard to provide for her extended family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

Violate has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.
Violate aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is married and works hard to support her family.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marylou is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Marylou has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build a restaurant at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 45 years old and is married with three children. She engages in selling used clothes in their village. Her business serves as their primary source of income. She has been in this business for five years. Right now, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 18,000 to buy more used clothes to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foam cups, sugar, etc. to make and sell ice cakes in her community.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Moustapha  habite au Sénégal.  Il est célibataire et  exerce l’activité d’élevage de poulet. Il capitalise une expérience de 2 ans dans le secteur de l’aviculture. C’est un adhérent de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Une fois de plus, il sollicite un crédit de 300.000 francs C FA en vue d’aménager un poulailler chez lui dans le but d’augmenter  la productivité de son activité avicole. Il souhaite accroitre ses revenus a travers ce financement  ce qui lui permettra de  renforcer son épargne et aussi  d’aider les membres de sa famille a améliorer leurs  conditions de vie alimentaires. Il aspire à devenir un grand aviculteur.
texts.en: Mr. Moustapha lives in Senegal. He is unmarried and has a business raising chickens. He capitalizes on two years of experience in this poultry sector. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where he has already paid back three previous loans. Once more, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA with the aim of fixing up his chicken coop at his house. The goal is to increase the productivity of his poultry business. He would like to grow his revenues through this financing, and this will enable him to bolster his savings and also to help his family members to improve their food situation. He aspires to become a major poultry farmer.

loans.use: to fix up a chicken coop at his house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Lucia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Daniela has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 46, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other like products. Customers are attracted to buy with her due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Imelda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes for a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for RTW products like pants, polo shirts, shorts fro kids, different dresses, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou est un résident du Sénégal. Il est marié et s’active dans le secteur du jardinage. Cela fait 22 ans qu’il  évolue  dans ce secteur. Il est  membre de  l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC où il a déjà honoré ses engagements relatifs aux quatre(04) crédits qu’il avait obtenus. Présentement, il sollicite un prêt de 500.000 francs CFA dans  le but de construire une chambre supplémentaire au sein de sa maison.  Les revenus que lui génère son activité de jardinage lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense  quotidienne de sa famille ainsi que le règlement des factures.  En outre, ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille. Son projet  futur est de développer sa propre firme spécialisée dans l’aménagent d’espace vert.
texts.en: Mr. Aliou is a resident of Senegal. He is married and active in the gardening sector, where he has worked for 22 years. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where he has already honored his commitments relative to four loans he had obtained. Presently, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA with the goal of building an additional bedroom in his home. The revenues that his garden business generates enable him to cover his family's day-to-day expenses, as well as to pay the bills. Furthermore, this loan will enable him to improve his family's living conditions. His future project is to develop his own firm specializing in developing green spaces.

loans.use: to build an additional bedroom in his home

loans.name: Mercy Flor

texts.en:
Mercy Flor is married and works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Mercy Flor is borrowing 24,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy medicine and vaccines for her livestock.

Mercy Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is a 50-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. She is also helping her nephews and nieces in their studies.

Erminda operates a repacking business. She packs different products that are ordered from a wholesaler and then sells them for a much higher price. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products like candies, pepper and other products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erminda hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a bigger source of income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like candies, pepper and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en:
Luaiva is a 26-year-old, single woman, with one child. She would like to start growing taro on her plantation to earn a living. 

Luaiva has requested a loan to buy knives, shovels, etc. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for one year. Luaiva will spend her profits to extend her plantation and to support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy knives, shovels, etc., so she can grow taro on her plantation.

loans.name: Jean Merlin

texts.fr: Jean Merlin est un jeune homme de 37 ans avec à sa charge 01 enfant. après ses études,il s'est lancé dans le petit commerce de friandises ( bonbons,biscuits,chewing-gums,chocolats..)et autres produits divers ( cigarettes,savon en poudre, brosse à dents..).il associe à cette vente,la commercialisation du credit de communication appellé vulgairement "CALL-BOX.il sollicite cependant un credit qui va lui permettre de distribuer en grande quantité son credit de communication, et augmenter son stock de marchandises.les bénéfices générés vont servir à diversifier son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Jean Merlin is a young man, 37 years old, who has one child to support. After his studies, he got started in the small-scale commerce of snacks (candies, cookies, chewing gum, chocolates,…) and general merchandise (cigarettes, powdered soaps, toothbrushes,…) He includes the sale of phone minutes, commonly called CALL-BOX. In any case, he is requesting a loan enabling him to distribute large amounts of phone minutes and to increase his stock of merchandise. The profits generated are going to diversify his business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (candies, cookies, chocolates) and also phone minute to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
Remelita previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were big for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Remelita dreams to give her children a good education and a good life. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy an additional stock of candies and toy products. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. This has been her business for 13 years now.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy an additional stock of candies and toy products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion hopes to help her nephews and nieces in their studies and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of candies and toy products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruphine Rosalie

texts.fr: Ruphine est une mère au foyer de 37 ans avec à sa charge 03 enfants.pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille,elle a ouvert depuis 02 ans un bar dans lequel elle commercialise les boissons (bières et jus).par ailleurs,elle associe à ce commerce,la vente de nourriture.elle sollicite pour ce fait,un credit pour s'approvisionner davantage en boissons et en aliments. les bénéfices générés vont permettre à Ruphine de diversifier son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante.elle souhaite également se servir de ces bénéfices pour régler la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ruphine is a 37-year-old homemaker with three children to support. To meet her needs and those of her family, she opened a bar two years ago where she sells beverages (beer and soft drinks). Besides this, she includes the sale of food. And so, she is requesting a loan to stock up with more beverages and foodstuff. The profits generated will enable Ruphine to diversify her business and satisfy her growing customer base. She would also like to use her profits to pay for her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise (beverages and food).

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, a 33-year-old married mother of three, wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes in her community. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services, and is requesting a start-up loan to buy foam cups, sugar, a cooler, etc. In the future, Maria hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to sugar, foam cups, and a cooler.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old, separated, and has four grown children. She is glad because her children are supportive in every decision she makes. Victoria has been running a variety store for ten years and aims to have a viable source of income so she can further secure her family's future and be able to save some money for emergencies.

Victoria is requesting a loan of PHP18,000 to purchase groceries, candies, biscuits, instant noodles, soft drinks, eggs and other basic commodities for her store. She knows that this loan will help make her business more profitable and enable her to provide quality service to all of her customers. Victoria really hopes for the ongoing success of her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase candies, biscuits, instant noodles, soft drinks, eggs and other basic commodities for her variety store.

loans.name: Sus

texts.en:
Sus is 41years old, married, and has six children. They live in a peaceful village in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Due to the hardships of living, she engages herself in two businesses to supplement her husband's income: farming and selling bean sprouts in a community market. She believes that her perseverance and effort will lead her to success, which is why she continues to work hard for her family. She is very happy to see her family-owned businesses going well. She is able to make an income of 5 USD each day. Sus has been working in her position for more than 10 years.

Sus has always dreamed of having a suitable house with a better living environment that is clean and sanitary. She wants to keep her family healthy and avoid any diseases. In this regard, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 750 USD to build a bathroom, along with a toilet, for her household. This loan amount will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, along with a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients and furniture

loans.name: Dibor

texts.fr: Madame Dibor  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et exerce  une double  activité.  Elle est enseignante et  en même temps pratique le commerce de tissus. Elle enseigne depuis 4 ans mais capitalise une expérience  de 7 ans dans l’achat et la vente de tissus. Elle est sociétaire  dans  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 150.000 francs CFA. Elle envisage avec son financement d’acheter des tissus qu’elle va revendre a sa clientèle. Elle souhaite aussi pouvoir diversifier les  marchandises  qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de chaussures et d’effets de toilette pour femmes Ainsi, avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle pourra mieux contribuer a la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Son projet futur est de développer davantage son activité commerciale  en expansion d’une part et d’autre part acquérir une école privée.
texts.en:
Dibor lives in Senegal, is married, and has two jobs. In addition to working as a teacher, she also works selling fabrics: she has been teaching for the past four years, and has seven years’ experience buying and selling fabrics.  

Dibor is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, where she has requested a loan of 150,000 francs CFA. With her financing, she plans to buy fabrics which she will then sell on to her customers. She also wants to be able to diversify the goods that she sells, moving into the sale of shoes and women’s toiletries. With the growth in her profits, she will be able to make a better contribution to managing her family’s daily expenses. In the future, she plans to develop her business even more by expanding, and she also plans to create a private school.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Houlèye

texts.fr: Agée de 74 ans, la dame Houlèye s’active toujours. Elle est veuve et  a 9 grands enfants dont l’ainé a 45 ans et le cadet, 20 ans. Il faut dire que parmi ses enfants il y a en qui travaille et ensemble ils affrontent les charges de la vie courante ; seulement elle ne pas les regarder faire c’est pourquoi depuis 5 ans elle a investi dans le transport. Et cela pour pouvoir les épauler. Là elle sollicite un crédit de 250000F pour acheter un cheval  qui fera du transport de personnes (calèche). Le crédit lui permettra de mettre de l’argent de coté afin de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
