texts.en: Houlèye is 74 years of age, and is still working. She is a widow and has nine grown-up children, the oldest of whom is 45 and the youngest 20 years of age. Some of her children work, and together they cover their daily needs. Houlèye doesn’t like to sit back and watch them work, and this is why five years ago she invested in transportation to be able to support them. She has requested a loan to buy a horse, which she will use to transport people (in a horse-drawn carriage). This loan will enable Houlèye to put some money aside, so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy a horse to use for transportation (a horse-drawn carriage).

loans.name: Glenda Herminia

texts.es:
Glenda vive en las Orquídeas, tiene 33 años de edad. Ella comenzó la profesion de taxista informal  porque le gustaba mucho manejar. Desde entonces  tiene un carro para conducir y hacer carreras de expresos y taxis. 

El trabajo lo realiza sola en diferentes horarios, gana muy bien haciendo carreras a cualquier lugar. También hace expreso a escuelas y colegios, para tener mayores ingresos.

No está casada, pero tiene dos hijos menores de edad que estudian en una escuela fiscal, sus hijos son su esfuerzo para seguir adelante y así poder darles lo mejor..

Con el préstamo Glenda quiere comprarse comprar repuestos para su carro y herramientas y asi  llevar más pasajeros, y también quiere mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Glenda, 33, lives in Las Orquídeas.  She started in the informal taxi service because she loves to drive.  She’s had a car since then to drive and do express routes and taxi service.   Her work is done in various schedules and she earns good income doing trips to any place.  She also does express services to schools and high-schools to earn higher income.  She’s not married but she has two minor children attending a local public school.  Her children are the reason she strives to move forward in order to give them the best.  Glenda will use the loan to buy spare parts for her car and tools so she can carry more passengers; she also wants to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
Jorge vive en las Orquídeas, tiene 34 años de edad. El comenzó su trabajo por el papá ya que el tiene un carro para conducir y hacer carreras (como taxista informal), desde entonces le gusto y es a lo que ahora se dedica como profesión. 

El trabajo lo realiza solo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las diez y media de la noche, gana muy bien haciendo carreras a cualquier lugar.

No está casado, pero tiene tres hijos menores de edad que estudian en una escuela fiscal, sus hijos son su esfuerzo para seguir adelante y así poder darles lo mejor.

Con el préstamo Jorge quiere terminar de arreglar su carro para que se vea más elegante, y presentado a sus clientes, y también quiere mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Jorge, 34, lives in Las Orquídeas.  He started this work thanks to his father since he has a car to drive and do routes as an informal taxi driver; since then he liked it too and it’s now his profession.  He works alone from six in the morning until ten-thirty at night.  He earns good income doing trips everywhere.  He’s not married but has three minor children attending a public school.  His children are his reason to strive to continue moving forward in order to give them the best.  Jorge wants to use his loan to finish repairing his car so it will be more elegant and attractive to his customers; he also wants to do some home repairs.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and his house.

loans.name: Twitezimbere B/ Gsz Group

texts.fr:
Frediane est de nationalite Rwandaise, et est membre du groupe TWITEZIMBERE B/ GSZ . Elle est marie , elle a 35 ans , elle a 4 enfants. le plus Age a 17 ans et le moins age a 5 ans.parmis ses enfants 3 vonts a l`ecole 
.
l`usage propose pour ce credit est d`acheter les semences pour ses pomme de terre ainsi que payer la main d`oeuvre.
les difficultes qu`elle attend pour le non remboursement de ce credit sont les mauvaises conditions climatiques , Epidemie agricole ainsi que les mauvaises recolte.

les strategie qu`elle a pour accroitre son activite finance sont de faire l`agriculture moderne en utilisant les engrais chimiques et les fumiers.

Pour son affaire, ses ambitions sont de devenir une grande distributrice des produits agricole.
pour sa famille ses  ambitions sont d`acheter une machine a coudre pour son metier de couture , d`acheter une vache et d`assurer le bien etre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Frediane is a Rwandan national and a member of the group TWITEZIMBERE B/ GSZ. He is married and 35 years old, and he has four children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 5. Three of his children are going to school. 

The proposed use for this loan is to purchase seeds for planting potatoes, as well as to pay for labor. The difficulties he expects for not paying back the loan are poor climatic conditions, crop epidemics, and bad harvests. 

The strategy he has for increasing his business is to employ modern agriculture by using chemical fertilizers and manure.

For work, his ambition is to become a major distributor of farm products. For his family, his ambitions are to purchase a sewing machine for his clothing trade and a cow and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Eduardo Marcelo

texts.es:
Eduardo vive en Manta, tiene 25 años de edad. En su trabajo es un maestro constructor. Con este trabajo adquiere dinero para el sustento de su familia.

El trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado, hace acabados de construcción, reparacion de paredes, pinta paraedes etc. Teme a enfermarse ya que es un hombre solo que tiene un hijo pequeño que estudia en una escuela fiscal, a quien tiene que mantener, y cubrir gastos en el hogar y en la educación de su hijo.

Es un hombre separado de su esposa, y con este préstamo quiere obtener herramientas para su trabajo, para así realizar mejor lo que le envíen hacer. Y lo que más desea es ser un maestro de construcción reconocido por todos.
texts.en: Eduardo, 25, lives in Manta and works as a master builder.  He earns money this way to support his family.  He works Monday through Saturday.  He does construction work, wall repairs, he paints walls, etc.  He fears becoming ill because he’s a man alone who has a little boy attending public school that he has to support and cover household and schooling costs.  He’s separated from his wife and wants to use this loan to buy work tools in order to do better work at the sites he’s sent to.  What he most wants is to become a master builder who is well-known by everyone.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Havea

texts.en: Havea is 42 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling snacks and drinks in her community and has been doing this for five years. Havea has requested a loan to buy snacks, drinks, a freezer, cups and plates. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Havea will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, a freezer, cups, and plates

loans.name: Alba Pastora

texts.es:
La Sra. Alba vive en Manta, tiene 37 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta mucho lo que hace en especial si es de comercio y es por esto que ella vende bocaditos de sal, tortas, empanadas.  

Ella realiza su trabajo todos los días de lunes a sábado, sale a vender a las tres de la tarde y regresa a las siete de la noche, ella vende empanadas, torta de verde, vario, etc.

Teme enfermarse ya que si esto sucede dejaría de trabajar, no está casada, tiene tres hijos y estudian en una escuela fiscal, ella dice que sus hijos son su esfuerzo para que ella siga adelante y darles lo mejor.

Con el préstamo quiere poder comprar una cocina y materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos como bocaditos, tortas, empanadas. Y así poder vender más cada día y así poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
La Sra. Alba vive en Manta, tiene 37 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta mucho lo que hace en especial si es de comercio y es por esto que ella vende bocaditos de sal, tortas, empanadas.  

Ella realiza su trabajo todos los días de lunes a sábado, sale a vender a las tres de la tarde y regresa a las siete de la noche, ella vende empanadas, torta de verde, vario, etc.

Teme enfermarse ya que si esto sucede dejaría de trabajar, no está casada, tiene tres hijos y estudian en una escuela fiscal, ella dice que sus hijos son su esfuerzo para que ella siga adelante y darles lo mejor.

Con el préstamo quiere poder comprar una cocina y materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos como bocaditos, tortas, empanadas. Y así poder vender más cada día y así poder tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: to buy a stove and raw materials.

loans.name: Angel Remigio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 52 años de edad, vive en Guayaquil. Empezó su negocio trabajando desde muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron la actividad. Desde luego el decidió trabajar como albañil, de igual manera también empezó con la venta de materiales de construcción.

El trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de Dios y con la de sus hijos, su negocio es más o menos ya que hay meses en las que dice que recibe ingresos de dinero muy bajos. Pero el sigue luchando para sacar adelante a su familia.

La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia, teme de los ladrones. Y el invierno ya que le perjudica la venta de materiales. Está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene hijos que ya son mayores de edad, no estudian.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construccion para poder ofrecer a sus clientes mas arreglos en sus casas y asi tener mayores ingresos de capital para los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Ángel, 52, lives in Guayaquil.  He started his business working when still very young; his parents taught him the activity.  He decided to work in construction and also started out selling building materials and supplies.  He works with God’s help and with help from his children.  His business does just OK because he says that some months his income is very low but he continues striving to move his family forward.  The difficulty he faces is crime; he fears robbers and in winter sales of his products suffer.  He’s married and his wife does household chores.  He has children who are all adults now and no longer in school.  He wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to sell to his customers and also to do repairs in their houses to earn higher income for his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Almuhammad

texts.ru: Алмухаммаду 30 лет. Он с женой проживает в районе Рудаки. Алмухаммад занимается животноводством более 5 лет и является опытным скотоводом. Он покупает мелко-рогатый скот и после откорма перепродает его с наценкой. Алмухаммад запрашивает кредит на сумму 1050 долларов с целью купли-продажи мелко-рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль он планирует увеличить поголовье своего крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Almuhammad is 30 years old and lives with his wife in Rudaki.  Almuhammad has worked with livestock for more than 5 years and is an experienced rancher.  He buys calves and after fattening them, he resells them at a premium.  Almuhammad is requesting a loan of $1050 in order to buy more calves.  With the profits, he plans to increase his herd of cattle.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Isaul

texts.es: Isaul, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, tiene 7 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua con su familia.  Don Isaul tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, tiene gran experiencia en la producción de  café, caña de azúcar, maíz y frijoles. La producción de café es en pergamino y en uva. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Sus cultivos han sido bien asistidos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente solicita el octavo préstamo que es por 20,000 lempiras. Con este crédito va pagar personal para siembra de caña y compra de 20 quintales de abono para mantenimiento de la finca de café y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Su meta es lograr cultivar dos manzanas de caña de azúcar para obtener mejores ingresos y de las ganancias apoyar a sus hijos con la educación y mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Isaul, 61, is married and has seven children.  He lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua.  Isaul has been working in agriculture for 15 years.  He has a lot of experience growing coffee, sugarcane, corn and beans.  Coffee production is both in parchment and grape.  He sells his production in the local market.  His crops have been well helped along thanks to various loans he’s invested in them.  He’s currently requesting his 8th loan for 20,000 Lempiras.  He will use this loan to pay for laborers for the sugarcane planting and to buy 20 quintals of manure for the coffee plants and basic grain crops like corn and beans.  His goal is to attain two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of sugarcane production to improve income and profits to pay for his children’s schooling and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, tiene  51 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de la Esperanza, Intibucá con su esposo y dos de sus hijos. Doña Lourdes tiene su propio negocio desde hace 15 años  en su casa, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser arroz, azúcar, pan, harinas, pastas, productos enlatados, churros, refrescos, etc.  Ella ha manejado varios prestamos con ODEF, el que esta solicitando es el sexto ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar mas productos alimenticios y abarrotes para seguir manteniendo surtido el negocio.  Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener siempre un mayor inventario y darles mejor atención a sus clientes, ya que su meta es hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Lourdes, 51, is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and two of her children in a village in the municipality of La Esperanza, Intibucá.  Lourdes has had her own, home-based business for 15 years where she sells basic staple items like rice, sugar, bread, flour, pasta, canned goods, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.  She’s managed several ODEF loans and the one she’s asking for now is her 6th and it’s for 15,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more food and grocery items to keep her store stocked.  This investment will help her always have a larger inventory on hand to provide better customer service since her goal is to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En el bello municipio de El sauce, habita María Alexandra, una joven de 33 años, casada, con dos hijos, cristiana que se dedicó desde joven a prepararse y hoy en día se graduó como Licenciada en ciencia de la Educación donde ejerce su profesión en un colegio de la localidad.
Desde que se casó su sueño con su esposo ha sido tener una casa con todas las condiciones para brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno donde vivir.

Por tal motivo solicita un crédito para construir la tapia del patio de su vivienda con el cual comprará ladrillos, hierro, cemento y pago de mano de obra, con el fin de tener mayor seguridad para ella y su familia.

Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le financien su préstamo para llevar a cabo su objetivo y agradece de antemano a estas personas de noble corazón por el apoyo que brindan a las personas de escasos recursos que por el bajo salario no se pueden cubrir estos gastos.
texts.en:
María Alexandra lives in the lovely of town of El Sauce. She is a young woman, 33 years old, married, with two children. She is a Christian. From a young age she has been a diligent student and graduated with a Degree in Education. She works as a teacher in a local school.

Since she got married it has been her dream, with her husband, to have a house with all the facilities in order to provide a decent home for her children to live in.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to build a wall for the yard of her house. She will buy bricks, steel, cement and pay for labour in order to improve security for herself and her family.

She hopes and trusts in God that the Kiva investors, through Ceprodel, will finance her loan so that she can carry out her objective. And she thanks those kind-hearted people in advance for the support that they give to people with scarce resources who, due to their salary, cannot cover these expenses.

loans.use: to buy bricks, steel, cement and pay for labour

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жительница города Душанбе. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Муж Замиры работает шофером. Наравне с мужем Замира тоже работает и обеспечивает семью. Она занимается вышиванием женской национальной одежды и принимает заказы у себя дома. Она работает портнихой уже 4 года. Замира берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машины и таким образом хочет улучшить процесс своей работы.
texts.en: Zamira is a resident of Dushanbe.  She's 24 years old and the married mother of three.  Zamira's husband works as a chauffeur.  Along with her husband, Zamira works to provide for the family.  She embroiders traditional national clothing for women, and accepts orders in her own home.  She has worked as a seamstress for four years.  Zamira is taking out a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine in order to improve the process of her work.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en: Starting with the MUK group that already existed in the village of Apuan, Tabanan, central Bali, Ni Made heard information about MUK, which provides training and loans for women who want to develop their economic income. Ni Made and her friends formed a group named Sari Rahayu with a membership of 10 people. As it’s become the responsibility of the head of the family to increase income, Ni Made wants to support her husband in their family. By forming a group, Ni Made can exchange ideas with other group members. Loans given by MUK will be used to purchase piglets and also to buy food supplies. In a period of six months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the economy of the family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and also to buy food supplies

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur, age 56, plants and harvests rice and vegetables to earn an income. He and his wife have four children and live in a rural community. 

Being a responsible father, he would like to to improve his family's standard of living and offer them a better life. For this reason, Arthur plans to engage in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

To start up his new business, Arthur is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000, which he will use as additional capital to buy piglets to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins for them. 

He believes that the loan will help him to build and improve the new business, and he hopes to make it successful and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins for them

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Taulabe.  El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, especialmente al  cultivo de café, pero hace dos años ha iniciado con otra actividad productiva que es la cría, engorde y venta de carne y de cerdos, y peces.  Ya tiene establecido el  mercado para la venta de su producción. El ha obtenido varios prestamos con ODEF para invertirlos en su negocio, actualmente solicita un quinto préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar insumos (alimento, vacunas etc) necesarios para la manutención de la cría y engorde de cerdos, esta inversión  le ayudara a vender a mejor precio y sus ingresos serán mayores. Su meta es incrementar sus negocios para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jorge, 37, is married and has two children.  He lives in a village that belongs to the municipality of Taulabe.  He’s always worked in agriculture, especially growing coffee, but two years ago he started a new activity: raising pigs to sell live and to sell pork and raising fish.  He already has a market for his products.  He’s gotten several ODEF loans to invest in his business and he’s currently requesting his 5th one for 10,000 Lempiras he’ll use to buy supplies (feed, vaccines, etc.) needed to care for and fatten up the pigs.  This investment will help him sell at a better price and his income will thus be higher.  His goal is to increase his businesses in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo, vive con una hermana en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. 
Miguel  tiene 15 años de haber establecido su propio negocio. El fabrica accesorios para vehículos como botaguas (protectores de agua) y spoiler.  El ya cuenta con su buena clientela en la zona y vende en otras ciudades. Actualmente   ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 21,000 lempiras para abastecerse de materia prima como plástico y fibra de vidrio para la fabricación de botaguas, spoiler  y otros accesorios de protectores para vehículos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener más clientela. El propósito es seguir adelante con el negocio y poder sustentar a su familia.
texts.en: Miguel, 35, is single and has a son.  He lives with his sister in a village in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  Miguel has had his own business for 15 years.  He manufactures auto parts like ‘botaguas’ (water deflectors) and spoilers.  He already has a good established clientele in his zone and he also sells in other cities.  He’s decided to request a 21,000 Lempira loan to stock up on raw materials like plastic and fiberglass to manufacture the deflectors, spoilers and other protective accessories for vehicles.  This investment will help him serve more customers.  His goal is to continue forward with the business in order to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fiberglass.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохире 26 лет. Она разведена и с одним ребенком живет у родителей. Мохира очень добрая и честная женщина. Несмотря на свой юный возраст она многое повидала в жизни. После развода с мужем Мохира быстро справилась с трудностями и начала работать. Вот уже 3 года как Мохира занимается торговлей. Она покупает хлебопекарные изделия (лепешки, хлеб, батон), и продает их с наценкой на рынке. Мохира берет кредит на сумму 1300 долларов для приобретения ассортимента товара и расширения своей точки продажи.
texts.en: Mohira is 26 years old.  She's divorced, has one child and lives with her parents.  She's a very kind and honest woman.  Despite her young age, she has seen a lot in her life.  After the divorce from her husband, Mohira quickly dealt with her new circumstances and began working.  She has been selling goods for three years now.  She buys baked goods (cakes, breads, baguettes), and sells them at a premium on the market. Mohira is requesting a loan of $1300 to buy an assortment of baked goods and to expand her selling location.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of baked goods.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn earns a living by operating a general store. She has been running her business for three years and earns PhP 300 a day. Her business serves as the primary source of income for her family. 

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy condiments, beverages, canned goods, noodles, and assorted breads to offer for sale in her store. 

Her goal is to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, beverages, canned goods, noodles, and assorted breads to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deogracias, age 32, and his wife operate a "talipapa" (a fruit and vegetable stall) to earn an income. They earn a monthly income of about PhP 20,000, which they apply toward supporting their family. The remainder serves as revolving capital for the business. 

Deogracias and his wife have a two-year-old child and a one-year-old baby. They work hard to provide sustenance for their children.
 
Deogracias aims to increase his family's income, which is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 40,000. He will use his loan funds to buy vegetables, canned goods, coffee, breads, and eggs to sell in his food stall.

In the future, Deogracias hopes to continually increase his income for the sake of the overall welfare and financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned goods, coffee, breads, and eggs to sell in his food stall

loans.name: Mamadou Boubou

texts.fr:
Mamadou Boubou, âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 11 enfants fait du commerce depuis 8 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et à revendre des motos. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour descendre à 19h du soir. C’est un habitué de l’IMCEC car il est à son 5ème crédit. Avec  le crédit il pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. 
Mamadou Boubou a comme projet futur d’ouvrir une quincaillerie.
texts.en: Mamadou Boubou, 45 years old, is married and the father of eleven children. He has been in business for eight years. His business involves purchasing and reselling motorbikes. He starts his day at 8:00 AM and finishes at 7:00 PM.  He is a regular at U-IMCEC, since he is on his fifth loan. With this loan, he will be able to improve his family's food situation. For the future, Mamadou Boubou's plan is to open a hardware store.

loans.use: to purchase motorbikes to resell

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Monsieur  Oumar, âgé de 39 ans, est marié et a 11 enfants dont l’ainé a 12 ans et un bébé de 4 mois. Il a une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans l’embouche. Il sollicite un crédit de 400000F CFA afin d’acheter du bétail, élever puis revendre. Il a démarré avec une un bœuf, et actuellement il désire augmenter  les têtes pour maximiser son profit. Vu l’ampleur qu’a pris son activité, monsieur Omar cultive un projet d’ouvrir une ferme d’élevage pour varier  les espèces.
texts.en: Mr. Oumar, 39 years old, is married, and he has eleven children, of whom the oldest is 12 years old, and the baby is 4 months old. Mr. Oumar has over five years of experience in raising livestock. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs CFA to purchase some livestock to raise and then resell. He started with one steer, and currently he would like to increase his herd to maximize his profit. Given the size his business has gotten, he is working on a project to start a farm for various kinds of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and resell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, age 52, raises hogs to earn an income. He lives in Capatan. He and his wife have raised two children, and he was able to sustain his family through his income from raising and selling hogs. However, one of his children had to stop attending school due to the financial burden on the family. 

Jose and his wife would like to attain better sales and profits by providing better nutrition to their hogs, which will spur the growth of the hogs and bring a better price at the point of sale. For this reason, Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 from ASKI. With his loan funds, he will buy feed and additional hogs to raise. 

By ensuring the health, growth, and nutrition of his hogs, he will be able to generate a better income, which will help him provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Crispin

texts.en:
Crispin raises hogs to earn an income. He and his wife live in Capatan and have raised one child, who is now grown and living separately. 

Crispin needs to generate a better income in order to sustain their daily consumption. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000, which he will add to his capital for the purpose of buying feed and additional hogs to raise and offer for sale.

Though he currently only generates minimal income, Crispin hopes eventually to expand his business and achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy hogs to raise and feed to sustain them

loans.name: Kalidou Mamadou

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Kalidou Mamadou, il est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants. Il s’active dans la vente de divers produits alimentaires (sucre, huile…) ou il a acquis une expérience de 18 ans .Il possède une cantine ou il pratique son activité commercial. Il commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 22h.  Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Mis à part le souci d’augmenter son stock, il a un projet plus grand, celui de construire sa maison.
texts.en: This borrower is called Kalidou Mamadou. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of six. He is active in selling a variety of grocery items (sugar, oil,…) and has acquired eighteen years of experience in it. He owns a stall where he operates his business. He starts his day at 7:00 AM and finishes at 10:00 PM. He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses. Apart from his concerns for increasing his inventory, he has bigger plans, that is, to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase grocery item (sugar, oil,...) to resell

loans.name: Caridad Bonna

texts.en:
Caridad Bonna is a single lady who lives in Pallua Sur with her mother. She is 39 years old and opened up a stall over a year ago. She usually gains about PHP 10,000 a month. It goes for meals, bills at home and revolving capital in the business. She is generating income to help sustain her family. 

Now, Caridad is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more vegetables, fish, soft drinks and longganisa (cured pork) to sell. She hopes to keep diversifying her sales in order to gain more profit and save for the sustenance of her family. 

She hopes to become a successful vendor in their village.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fish, soft drinks and longganisa (cured pork) to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Raised as an orphan, Amos had a difficult life until he discovered a secret in doing business. He started a very small business which has grown to a good size, and over the years he has been able to to buy a number of cows, which he turned into a second business. 

This cattle-fattening business soon become more profitable than all the other businesses he had ever done, and he now wants to put in all the effort it deserves. 

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 to boost his cattle-fattening business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Swaibu

texts.en:
Swaibu is married with four children who are all school going. He is a hardworking man involved in many businesses to see that his family gets to eat. Swaibu is involved in peasantry farming as well trade in agricultural produce mainly maize, ground nuts and beans. The area where he lives is predominantly known for producing much of these products (produce). He has been in this business for the last nine years and he is always challenged by the changing weather conditions, which affect agricultural production, plus the price fluctuations on the market.
Swaibu wants a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more produce (beans, maize and ground nuts) for trade so that he can realize good returns at the end of the season.
Swaibu has a dream of acquiring more land, venturing into commercial farming, and seeing the living standard of his family improve. He is confident the lender will give him a hand to see his dream come true. In the photo is Swaibu with the Ugafode credit officer in a tie.

loans.use: To buy stock in the form of beans, maize and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, age 42, runs a food stall, where she prepares and sells food items. She has been doing this for the last two years, and she has gained a wide range of regular customers. She lives with her husband and their five children in Likoni, Kenya. Her primary expenditure is rent and the payment of her children's school fees

She is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 10,000, which she will use to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, 30 liters of cooking oil, and a sack of peas.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, 30 liters of cooking oil, and a sack of peas

loans.name: Maafavae

texts.en:
Maafaave, age 52, is a taro farmer. She has been growing and harvesting taro plants on her small plantation for the past three years. She and her husband have six children.

Maafaavae as been a member of SPBD since 2010. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, gloves, bush knives, seedlings, and two wheelbarrows. 

With her profits, Maafaavae hopes to make essential repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, gloves, bush knives, seedlings, and two wheelbarrows

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 47, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell these items at a small profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy her wares due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PhP) in sales every day.

Imelda lives in Cabrera, Pasay, with her husband Roldan and their children. She and her husband manage their household together while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

To help her continue operations of her business, Imelda is requesting a PhP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan funds to buy second-hand clothing items and new merchandise such as undergarments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes eventually to add more stalls and dreams of providing her children with a good education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing items and new merchandise such as undergarments to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Gilma Dinora

texts.es:
Doña Gilma es originaria de la comunidad Los zarzales del municipio de El Jicaral donde ha vivido toda su vida, estudió la carrera de Magisterio porque le satisface enseñar a leer y escribir a niños que son el futuro de Nicaragua.

Tiene 22 años de laborar como profesora de primaria, profesión que le ha permitido llevar el sustento de su hogar y sacar adelante sola a sus hijas sin la ayuda del padre, lo que le hace una mujer luchadora y emprendedora porque ha salido adelante con esfuerzo propio.

Por medio de su trabajo se dio cuenta que existen unos inversionistas llamado Kiva que financia crédito a través de Ceprodel a personas sobre todo de escasos recursos y solicitó por primera vez un financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda con el cual quiere ponerle cerámica, comprar el cemento y pagar la mano de obra para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Gilma is from Los Zarzales, in the municipality of El Jicaral. She has lived there all her life. She studied primary school teaching because she likes teaching children to read and write. They are the future of Nicaragua.

She has been a primary school teacher for 22 years. This job has enabled her to provide for her family and raise her daughters by herself without the help of their father. As a result, she is a determined and enterprising woman who has got on in life thanks to her own efforts.

Through her work she found out about the people known as Kiva investors who finance loans via Ceprodel, in particular to people with scarce resources. This is her first loan request. She wants to improve her house by tiling it. She will buy the tiles and cement and pay for the labour in order to have better conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy tiles and cement and pay for labour

loans.name: Alex Enrique

texts.es:
Alex tiene negocio de la mueblería. Le gusta mucho este negocio y algún dia desea dedicarse en un 100% a la mueblaría, tener un local para hacer su fábrica y quisiera dar trabajo a otras personas con más tiendas y abastecer otras tiendas.
Alex va a usar su préstamo para invertir en capital, como maquinaria para carpintería y materiales para armar los muebles. Alex tiene 34 años y un hijo de 9 años. Le ha gustado trabajar con Fundo Esperanza  por la confianza que da en cada uno de los prestatarios, además de los cursos de venta y emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Alex has a furniture business.  He really likes this business and one day he hopes to work 100% in it, have a space to set up his shop and employ other people with stores and supply to other stores.
Alex is going to use his loan to invest in capital, such as carpentry machinery and materials to assemble the furniture.  Alex is 34 and has a nine-year-old son.  He has enjoyed working with Fundo Esperanza because of the way they entrust each of the borrowers, in addition to the sale and entrepreneurship courses they provide.

loans.use: to buy carpentry machinery and materials to assemble the furniture

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa  is a 27-year-old, married woman, with three children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Theresa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, and sprayers. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) this year. With her profits, Theresa hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, and vegetable seeds for her garden.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is 27 years old. She is married and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more flour, sugar, and oil for her business. In the future, Litia hopes to use her profits to help with her child's education and her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, salts, and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Prabhat Kumar

texts.en:
Prabhat Kumar is a 28-year-old differently able man living with his parents in the village of Nayagarh, Odisha. His father is a farmer. He owns a small grocery store at his house where he sells detergents, shampoos, spices, toffees, rice, lentils, wafers, edible oil etc. earning 5,000 INR per month from his shop. This is the only source of income for the family. Prabhat Kumar has been working hard to take care of his parents.

He plans to buy more stock and variety of spices, oil, personal care merchandise like shampoos, detergents, and toothpaste that he is selling right now and more variety of chocolates and wafers, for which he has requested for a loan of 25,000 INR. He says that doing so will increase his family's income and he will be able to save some money for future uncertainties.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, shampoos, spices, toffees, rice, lentils, wafers, edible oil, etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta, 30, is a married woman with two children. She makes and sells taro and fried chicken in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business.

Roseta needs a loan to purchase more taro and chicken for the business. She plans to use her profits to help pay for her kids' education and to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro, cooking oil, chicken, a cooking pot, onions, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita, 45, is married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Alita is borrowing 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

She has been hog raising for 21 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle repair. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married, with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries, like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, and beverages.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and she also earns an income from hog-raising. Josephine aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store, like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре 44 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Все дети учатся в школе, Старшая дочка в этом году заканчивает школу. Гулсара с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 5,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойные коровы, 5 овец  ежемесячная прибыль с продажи молока местному перерабатывающему заводу составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и на образование старшей дочери.
texts.en: Gulsara is 44 years old, married and has four children.  All of the children attend school.  The oldest daughter is graduating from school this year.  Gulsara has been involved in animal husbandry since 1995, having started this business with an initial sum of 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, today the business contains one dairy cow and five sheep, and the monthly profit from sales of milk to the local processing plant amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Gulsara requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy 15 sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and providing an education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of frozen and processed foods, such as hotdogs, baby back ribs, stuffed meat, and ham, as well as other frozen products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 31, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is still single and lives with her parents. She is helping them manage their house as she works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. She has been in this business for two years now.

Marites operates the buy and sell business of her family, buying general merchandise from wholesalers and selling it with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to purchase by to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Marites dreams that her family business will be more successful. She also desires to have a business of her own. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise like pants and children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Winnieora

texts.en:
Winnieora  is 23 years old and married, with two children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Winnieora has requested a loan to buy tools and chemicals for her plantation. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Winnieora will plan to expand her business and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and tools for her plantation.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is 45 years old, married, and lives with her five children. She is very hard-working and is always setting a good example. She married Ali, who is a teacher at a nearby school. They live in Likoni, in her rental house. Their major monthly expenditure is the paying of school fees. 

Mwanamisi owns a food cafe where she has been working for the last two years. She is approaching Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan amounting to KES 20,000 to buy bundles of maize and wheat flour. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 53 años; casado con Felicia hace 13 años,madre de su única hija , viven en una casa propia ubicada en un barrio agrícola.De gran inteligencia y astucia para los negocios, Arturo se dedica a varias actividades. Hace 30 años que se dedica al servicio de trasporte público con su propia movilidad. Con las ganancias obtenidas empezó a criar animales como cuyes y chanchos, los cuales engorda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. “Por cada chancho estoy ganado de 300 a 400 soles. Si me conviene.”, menciona.
Ahora también tiene un negocio de cereales y granos molidos. Para ello adquirió un molino que le facilita el trabajo. De esa manera elabora harinas de quinua, maca, soya, maíz y otros. Cuenta que la va muy bien, pues compra sus insumos en Lima, para después moler las harinas, cuyo peso se duplica vendiendo sus productos por kilos a un mayor precio.
Ahora piensa adquirir más granos para continuar con su negocio de cereales molidos.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y se siente a gusto de formar parte de un grupo solidario. Éste sería su crédito número 6 con MFP. Confía que logrará sus metas gracias al apoyo de ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Arturo, con los 2000 soles solicitados podrá comprar granos de cereales para venderlos molidos.
texts.en:
Arturo, 53, has been married to Felicia for 13 years and she is the mother of his only daughter. They live in their own home in an agricultural region. 

Arturo has great business sense and intelligence and works in various jobs. For 30 years he has worked in public transport with his own vehicle. With the money he earned he started raising animals like guinea pigs and pigs, which he fed up and sold at the whole sale market in the city. He notes that for each pig he earns 300 - 400 PEN, it suits me.

Now he also has a business selling cereals and milled grains. He has acquired a mill in order to help with the work. In this way he makes different types of flour, included quinoa, maca, soya, corn and others. He says that is going very well as he buys his ingredients in Lima, which he later mills into flours, whose weight doubles selling his products by the kilo at a better price.

Now he is thinking about acquiring more grains to continue his milled cereal business. He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Muruhuay" and he feels happy to be a part of this united group. This will be his 6th loan with MFP, he believes that he will achieve his goals thanks to your support. He also promises to be punctual with his payments. Arturo, will use the 2000 PEN requested to buy cereal grains, which he will sell milled.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains.

loans.name: Marguba

texts.ru:
Маргуба очень скромная и порядочная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она с детства помогала родителям выращиванию скота. После замужества у нее было очень трудное условие проживания, так как ее муж занимается услугой мастера ремонта по дому и его доход  маленький. Маргуба на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Год за годом дети требуют все больше благ. Она решила организовать свой бизнес для получения дохода.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она получила много новой информации для себя и написала свой бизнес-план. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания и таким образом принесет радость в ее дом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Marguba is a very modest and decent woman.  She is 28 years old.  She has been helping her parents raise livestock since childhood.  After getting married, her life has been very hard because her husband is involved in providing house repairs, and his income is very small.  Marguba is raising three children.  Her children grow year after year and demand more comforts.  She decided to organize her own business to earn an income.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association for Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  She learned a lot of new information from this course for herself and wrote her business plan.  She wants to organize a business of buying and selling livestock because she has experience in this type of business.  Marguba is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy livestock in order to start her new business.  This loan will help her to improve her living conditions and, thus, bring happiness to her home.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air compressor, bumpers, benders, doors, and tools, and to purchase a truck to haul the materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy wood and a wood cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Mr. Gantugs, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife works as a nursing officer at a rehabilitation center. His two sons, 15 and 10 years old study in ninth and seventh grade respectively. His only daughter who is three years old stays at home. He himself has been working as a stonemason for the Mongolian Stonemason Association since 2000 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this art. The house they live in has deteriorated and needs some serious repair. Using his previous loans, he almost finished renovating his house. Now only some interior repair work such as ceiling installation, wallpaper decoration, etc. remains. So he is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to cover the costs of building materials such as wallpapers, emulsion and glue.  As well as payment for the repair work. Then the family can live in a comfortable, warm house.  They will be able to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve his family’s living standard as well as invest in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as emulsion, wallpapers and glues to finish interior renovations.

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina works diligently in order to earn a living. She is 52 years of age, married, and blessed with seven children. Four of her children currently go to school, while the other three are already working. 

Darlina has been running a retail store for six years. According to her, she earns about PHP 5,000 per month. She uses this income for her children's allowances, household expenditures, and other school expenses.

Darlina would like to increase her sales and profit, so she could let her four children finish their studies and improve their living conditions. With her determination to re-stock her store, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy some necessary merchandise, such as eggs, soft drinks, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, and assorted biscuits. She believes that this amount will help her in attaining her goals in life and with her business. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be approved.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise for her store, such as eggs, soft drinks, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, and assorted biscuits.

loans.name: Caps Capulin Y Sam Blas Group

texts.es: El Comité de Agua Potable y Saneamiento Capulín y San Blass (CAPS CSB), se encuentra ubicado en el km 34 ½, carretera a Granada, Nicaragua. El CAPS abastece de agua potable a 850 familias de las comunidades de San Blass, El Capulín y los Ángeles, siendo alrededor de 4,250 personas beneficiadas. El CAPS tiene 4 tanques de almacenamiento de agua, los cuales necesitan de mantenimiento urgente, la red de tubos de distribución necesita de mantenimiento también, el cual no se realiza desde hace mucho tiempo. En representación de los usuarios, la junta directiva del CAPS ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de base, pinturas, anticorrosivos y materiales para dar mantenimiento a los tanques, así como llaves de pase, pegas y tubos de PVC para la red de distribución. Con esta inversión el CAPS podrá asegurar la durabilidad de los tanques y el abastecimiento de agua potable a sus comunidades por muchos años.
texts.en:
The Capulín and San Blass Water and Sewerage communal bank (CAPS CSB) is based in 34 1/2 km down the road to Granada in Nicaragua. CAPS provides drinking water to 850 families in the communities of San Blass, El Capulín and Los Angeles, which is around 4250 people benefiting from their services.

CAPS has 4 tanks storing water, which are in need of urgent maintenance, the distribution pipes are also in need of maintenance, which hasn't been carried out for a long time. Representing their users, the CAPS board of directors has requested financing to buy the paints, anti-corrosives and materials needed to maintain the tanks as well as the stop cocks, glues and PVC piping for the distribution network.

This investment will allow CAPS to ensure the durability of the tanks and the provision of drinking water to their communities for many years.

loans.use: to buy paint, anti-corrosives, tank maintenance materials, stopcocks, glues and PVC pipes.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба родилась в 1966 года. Она человек с чистой душой и добрым сердцем. Махбуба замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 19 и 12 лет. Ее муж Шавкат очень хороший и любящий муж, но он получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для содержания семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Махбуба решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания в продовольственном магазине. Ее муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса.  От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba was born in 1966.  She is a person with a pure soul and a kind heart.  Mahbuba is married and raising two children, who are 19 and 12 years old.  Her husband, Shavkat, is a very good and loving husband, but he earns a small salary, which is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities.  Mahbuba decided to help her husband for the well-being of the family.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association for Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Now she is well-qualified to organize her own business and become successful in this field.  Mahbuba wants to start a business of buying and selling food products at a food market.  Her husband will help her run the business.  She plans to improve their living conditions with the resulting income.  Mahbuba is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy merchandise in order to start her new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to start her new business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana, 48, is married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Diana is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en: Faleala is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams, and taamu (a root vegetable) to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faleala has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killers, fertilisers, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Faleala hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizer, chemicals, shovels, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Gliceria aimed to improve her variety store to generate sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve the business. She planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy the demand of her customers. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, fruits and vegetables to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, fruits, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has four children, ages 1, 3, 5, and 7. Two of his children are in school. He also has two dependents who are orphans.
John started a retail business selling beer and soda. This business is located on the outskirts of Kagadi, where the residents are his major customers. He is also involved in sugarcane growing and cattle rearing as other activities to generate income for the family.
John wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more beer and soda to sell. Because of the limited capital in the business, John is unable to realize good returns from the business, but he anticipates receiving more returns if he is better funded. His dream is to expand his business to a wholesale level and also to be in a position to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more items like body lotion, soap, perfume and other personal products for her personal products business.

Merly has been in this business for six years. Merly earns more income from a general store.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, soap, perfume and other personal products.

loans.name: Lagise

texts.en: Lagise is a 50-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business sewing and buying clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Lagise has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, a set of needles, and rolling materials. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family and her kids' educations. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and fabric material,.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Elle s’appelle Hawa et cela fait 6 ans maintenant qu’elle fait du commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, divorcée et mère de famille. Elle est à son 3ème crédit à l’IMCEC et veut renouveler afin de pouvoir acheter un réfrigérateur et l’installer dans sa boutique. Car c’est bien d’une boutique qu’il s’agit en ce qui concerne son activité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour fermer à 23h du soir.
Hawa étant une femme ambitieuse, elle fait de l’épargne régulière afin de construire un jour sa maison à elle.
texts.en:
This woman is named Hawa and she has been selling foodstuffs for six years now. She is 45 years old, divorced, and a mother.

Hawa is on her 3rd loan from UIMCEC and wants to take another to be able to purchase a refrigerator to install in her shop, which is a real shop for her business.

She begins her day at 8am and closes at 11pm. Hawa is an ambitious woman; she saves regularly to one day build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs ([for her] shop) to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a 33-year-old married lady with three children. She lives in Likoni, Kenya with her husband and children. All of her chldren are in school; their school fee payment is a major expenditure. She owns a cafe at which she sells food. She wakes up every morning to prepare the food and sell it. She has been in this business for more than two years and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her customers and income range. She has requested a loan amounting to KES 60000 to buy wheat, maize flour, 40 litres of cooking oil, and seats for the cafe.

loans.use: to buy wheat, maize flour, 40 litres of cooking oil, and seats for her cafe.

loans.name: Siomia

texts.en: Siomia is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, black pepper, green onions, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.Siomia has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, a pair of hoses, a pair of gloves, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits,Siomia hopes to improve her business to help with her family matters and her kid's educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and gloves

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en: Sieni is a 33-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small auto repair business. She has three years in this business. Sieni needs a loan to buy an air compressor, tool boxes, an electric grinder, and a car jack. She will use her profits to improve her business and help her family and her kids' educations. Sieni joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, tool boxes, and a car jack

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is from the small town of Lagodekhi. She is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband, son and a daughter-in-law. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her job, which is usually demanded by the local credit providers. The only source for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Nino’s husband working as a cook. The income is hardly enough for the four-member family. Nino’s loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Nino will purchase clothing and bed clothing at wholesale prices and resell them in her town and nearby villages for a profit. It will be hard work for Nino, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Faotaota

texts.en: Faotaota is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, carrots, green peppers, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faotaota has requested a loan to buy chemicals, spades, a hose, a pair of gloves, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits,Faotaota hopes to improve her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, spades, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and shovels

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Ousseynou est un jeune professeur d’histoire-géo, âgé de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant, qui est entré dans l’enseignement il y a de cela 2 ans. Il a démarré les travaux de construction de sa maison et vient solliciter un petit crédit afin d’honorer le payement des frais de main-d’œuvre des maçons. Il s’occupe de sa dépense quotidienne. 
Il rêve d’avoir une grande villa ou il installera toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Ousseynou is a young history and geography teacher. He is 31 years old, single with no children, and has been teaching for two years. He began construction of his home and is requesting a small loan to pay the labor costs of the masons. He takes care of his own daily expenditures.

He dreams of having a big house where his entire family can live with him.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Teodora Florinda

texts.es:
Teodora vive en Guayaquil, tiene 48 años. Comenzó su negocio hace 15 años (1998), cuando vendio un terreno que tenia en el Progreso, es hay que decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de víveres y abarrotes en general, poco a poco creció y ahora posee una tienda con muy buena clientela.

La clienta trabaja en su negocio desde las 6:30 de la mañana, realiza pedidos de mercaderías cada quince días. No tiene dificultades en su negocio y con la ayuda de Dios va progresando día a día.
Está casada, tiene tres hijos, son mayores de edad y viven independientes. Su esposo la ayuda trabajando en el comercio  o venta de cangrejos.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, azucar, granos, bebidas. El sueño o meta que tiene la clienta con este  es de poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Teodora, age 48, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business 15 years ago (1998).  She did this when she sold a piece of land she had in El Progreso.  She decided to establish her own business selling supplies and general groceries.  It grew little by little, and she now has a store with very good clientele.

She starts work in her business at 6:30 in the morning.  She orders merchandise every 15 days.  She does not have any difficulties in her business, and with God’s help she is making day to day progress.

She is married and has three children who are adults and live independently.  Her husband helps her by working in commerce or selling crabs.

She wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, grains, and drinks.  Her dream or goal is to, through the business, be able to improve construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, and drinks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina offers native cakes and various kinds of vegetables within her local community. She has been doing this kind of business for ten years. Aside from this business, Rosalina also runs a livestock business as an additional source of income for her family. Rosalina is married and has four children. Three of her children are still studying, while the other one is a farmer.
Rosalina plans to improve the taste of her native cakes and to increase the vegetables she offers because she has many orders but has sold out of her products. For her to make her business more productive and profitable, she decided to join this lending program to obtain additional capital for continuous improvement of her food production and sales business. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be using this amount to buy eggplant, bitter gourd, string beans, and some ingredients for her native cakes such as sugar, condensed milk, and gluten for her food production and sales business. She is looking forward to approval of her requested loan amount. She hopes to send her three children into higher levels of education and to sustain her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, bitter gourd, string beans, and some ingredients for her native cakes such as sugar, condensed milk, and gluten for her food production and sales business.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Angella has been working hard to manage her small market where she sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Angella has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava to sell and will help Angella to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her family. Angella hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a better life. 

Angella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava to sell

loans.name: Gauula

texts.en: Gauula is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Gauula has requested a loan to buy new weed killer, weed spray, fertilizers, spades, a wheel barrow, and a pair of new axes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, she hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy new weed killer, a wheel barrow, a pair of axes, and spades

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Он имеет большой пятнадцатилетний опыт в сфере животноводство. Его отец занимался разведением скота и Немат с детство помогал отцу. У него был один баран, за которым он должен был ухаживать. Как говорит сам Немат: «Я очень любил своего маленького серого барана. Тогда  это было детским увлечением. Теперь это мой доход и заработок на жизнь». Он вырос и пошёл по стопам отца. Начал свое дело с двух голов барана. Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время, когда вся земля было покрыто снегом  и приходилось тратить больше средств на корм скота. Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Немат стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. Теперь на сегодня он имеет более 50 голов барана. Его жена и трое детей также вовлечены в это дело. Немат также мастер - каменщик и штукатур. Подрабатывает дополнительно для проживания, обучение детей и ежедневные расходы. В связи с сезонностью он не может продавать своих баранов  сейчас, так как цены на них упали. Немат нуждается в дополнительных средствах для дальнейшего корма скота и приобретения новых скотов. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом.  На полученный кредит планирует купить скот.  Выражает благодарность Арванд  за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en:
Nemat lives in a rural area, far from the city. He has a big fifteen year experience in the field of animal husbandry. His father was engaged in livestock breeding and Nemat since childhood helped his father. 

He had one sheep for which he had to provide care. As Nemat himself says, "I was very fond of that little gray sheep. Then that was a child's enthusiasm. Now this is my income and life earnings." He grew up and followed in his father's footsteps. He started his activities with two heads of sheep. Initially, it was not easy for him, especially in the winter when the whole earth was covered with snow and he had to spend more money to feed the livestock. But years of experience proved themselves out and Nemat began to find ways to address the challenges and to better promote his business. 

Now, he has more than 50 head of sheep. His wife and three children are also involved in the business. Nemat is also a master bricklayer and plasterer. He works part-time for accommodation, his children's education and daily expenses. 

Due to the season, he cannot sell his sheep now as prices have fallen. Nemat needs additional resources to continue caring for his livestock and to acquire new livestock. To this end, he appealed to MDO Arvand for a loan. He plans to use the loan to buy livestock. He is grateful to Arvand for the support and their huge rule in his life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – из Хуста. Она работает главным бухгалтером в двух частных фирмах. Она живет в квартире вместе с мужем, дочкой и внучкой. 
Сумма в 15 000 гривен необходима Марии для личных целей, а именно для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в квартире. Мария намерена заменить газовый котел старого образца на новый современный эконом класса. Проделанный ремонт поможет ей не только сделать условия проживания своей семьи намного более комфортными, но и существенно экономить на коммунальных выплатах.
texts.en:
Mariya is from Khoost. She works as the main accountant for two private companies. She lives in an apartment together with her husband, daughter and granddaughter. 

The amount of 15,000 hrvynia is necessary for Mariya for personal use, namely in order to refurbish the apartment. Mariya is going to replace the old-style gas boiler with a new, modern one of economic type. Making the renovation will not only help her to make the family's living conditions a little more comfortable, but also to save on utility payments.

loans.use: to refurbish her apartment, replacing the boiler

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en: Jomar is 22 years old and still single. He planned to earn and save more income to help his parents in financing the education of his younger brother and sisters. Due to lack of job opportunities, Jomar engages in buying and selling of betel nuts and tobacco in their community to generate income. He aimed to strengthen the business in order to generate sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, he is requesting an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of betel nuts and tobacco to sell in the community. He is hoping that this loan will make it possible for him to improve and strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of betel nuts and tobacco to sell

loans.name: Gasolo

texts.en: Gasolo is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, and caprioka to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Gasolo has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killers, bush knives, fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, and baby taro. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Gasolo hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, gloves, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, a hard-working 61-year-old, lives with his wife Marina and son George in the small village of Abasha district. Zurab has seven cows whose milk is used to produce about 50 kg. of cheese per month which Marina sells locally. Zurab also grows maize upon three hectares of agricultural land and earns additional income repairing refrigerators.

Zurab has requested a loan for purchasing pigs to expand his livestock business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells soft drinks and foods. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more passion fruit for making juice soda and water, and it will help Sarah to generate greater profits and support her family with the basic needs. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruit for making juice soda and water

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 52, lives in the Vani district with his retired mother, his son, and his daughter-in-law. The family runs a dairy farm that has two calves and three milk cows, whose milk is used for making cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, David owns a plot of land where he grows nuts. He sells an average of 300 to 400 kilograms of nuts per month. For additional income, David purchases chicks in spring, raises them, and sells the hens at a profit. 

David has requested a loan in order to purchase chicks for his poultry farming venture. He considers his business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables him to support his family. 

David is a hard-working man who is responsible and very well-known in the area for his big heart and his friendliness to others. He hopes to improve his business ventures so that he can raise the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркул 39 лет, замужем.Мать 4 детей. Атыркул с 2010 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 40,000 сом (KGS).
