Благодаря упорному труду Атыркул - на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве находится 1 корова, 5 овец, 1 лошадь и 5 коз, что приносит примерно 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота – молодняка. Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и образование детей.
texts.en:
Atyrkul is 39 years old, married and the mother of four children. Since 2010, Atyrkul has been engaged in raising animals, starting this business with a sum of 40,000 som (KGS). 

Through hard work, Atyrkul today has in her homestead one cow, five sheep, a horse, and five goats, which bring in about 14,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk produced by the cows. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Atyrkul appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy young cattle. Atyrkul plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her homestead and for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Liliya

texts.ru:
Лилия – предприниматель из Гладковки. Она уже 8 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством, выращивая ранние и поздние помидоры, огурцы, клубнику, редис, морковь и сахарную кукурузу. 
Лилии понадобилась сумма в размере 13 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку на 8 400 гривен и установить дополнительную теплицу на 4 600 гривен. Полученные от КИВА средства помогут Лилии содержать и расширять имеющееся тепличное хозяйство, а также восполнят насущные нужды семьи.
texts.en:
Liliya is an entrepreneur from Gladkovka. She has been working with greenhouse farming for 8 years already, growing early and late tomatoes, cucumbers, strawberries, radishes, carrots and sweet corn. 

Liliya needed a sum in the amount of 13,000 hryvnia in order to purchase plastic film for 8,400 hryvnia and set up an additional greenhouse for 4,600 hryvnia. Receiving these funds from Kiva helps Liliya support and expand her existing greenhouse business, and further to fill the immediate needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film and set up an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Sadru, who is in his early 40s, is married and has two girls who go to school. For a period of three years now, Sadru has been running a butcher business. He is very hardworking. He works from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily and is earning a good profit per month.
This will be his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to repair his butcher premises by installing a new aluminum door and tiles, to build a house with two rooms in the village, and to buy a TV, a meat cutter machine, and a deep freezer for his business. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He is requesting a new loan to open another butcher shop in another location. His dream is to one day be able to build a modern house.
He will share this loan with his loan group "Serakazi," which has 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another butcher shop in another location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural products (maize, beans)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 43 years old and lives with her husband and her five children aged 18, 15, 12, 10, and 6, who are all still in school. She is a hard working business lady who owns a motorbike. She has been operating this business for the last five years, which has helped her gain much experience and regular customers. She plans to buy a new motorbike and hire a person to work on it. It is for this reason that she has requested a loan amounting to ksh. 1,000,000 to buy a new motorbike and hire a person to operate it. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and hire a person to operate it for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tents, furniture, and crockery for her son's catering business.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахору 49 лет. Она мотивированная и успешная женщина. Ее муж Бахтиер очень гордится ею. Они имеют 1 не совершеннолетнего ребенка. Гулбахор живет вместе семьей счастливо, но бедно. Их доход не позволяет купить все необходимые вещи для проживания и поэтому Гулбахор решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды.  С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она обучилась многому, и теперь она готова организовать свой бизнес. Она будет торговать на местном рынке, и ее муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 49 years old. She is a motivated and successful woman. Her husband Bakhtier is proud of her. They have one child who is not yet an adult. Gulbahor lives together with her family happily, but poorly. 

Their income does not allow them to buy all the necessary things for a living, and therefore Gulbahor decided to organize her own business buying and selling men's clothing. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. From this course, she learned a lot, and now she is ready to organize her own business. She will trade in the local market, and her husband will help her in running the business.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 somoni to buy goods, in order to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, age 34, operates a motorcycle transport business. He is also engaged in a fishing venture to earn additional income. He lives with his wife and their three young children.

Armando is requesting a loan in order to buy fishing nets and to purchase fuel for the motorcycle. With this investment, he will be able to improve both his ventures and eventually increase his income. 

In the future, Armando dreams of making his business a success and to save enough money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to purchase fuel for the motorcycle

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio, age 27, lives in the Samtredia district with her husband, her parents-in-law, and her infant daughter. Sopio’s husband is a soldier, her father-in-law is an auto mechanic, and her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs a dairy farm. They have one milk cow, whose milk is used for making cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, Sopio purchases chicks in the spring, raises them, and sells the hens at a profit. Sopio is a hard-working young woman who is responsible and very well-known in the area for her big heart and her friendliness to others. 

Sopio has requested a loan in order to purchase chicks for her poultry farming venture. She considers her business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables her to help support her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Godliver, who is in her mid 40s, is married with one adult child who is married. Godliver has had a restaurant business offering different kinds of food services for a period of nine years now.  She works from 6am to 9pm daily and she is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous 12 loans to buy a plot of land where she started building her house, paid school fees, household expenses, bought more business items like new chairs, and new buckets and replaced the old charcoal stoves. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more business items, cover school fees and proceed on her house building. Her dream is to one day be able to open a wholesale water business.

She will share this loan with her group " Mnuka", which totals 11 members . The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more business items, cover school fees and proceed on her house building.

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en: Gogita is a 22 year old man. He is married and lives with his wife, mother, and an infant son in the small village of Khoni district. Gogita is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a horse and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Gogita also has 1.25 hectares of agricultural land, where maize is grown. In addition Gogita brings wood from the forest by horse to sell locally. He is a very hard working young man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. He requested a loan to purchase a milk cow so the family can expand its livestock and thus increase its income. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en:
Dorothy's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Dorothy is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair cosmetic lotions for the salon, and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and expand her business by adding a greater variety of items in her business. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to accumulate more capital. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy hair cosmetic lotions for her salon

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel, age 40, is a farmer. He earns an income by planting, harvesting, and selling rice and vegetables. He and his wife have three school-aged children. Being a responsible father, he is committed to providing for the education his children and offering them a better life. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Manuel needs to increase his income in order to support his children's education. For this reason, he has started buying and selling iron and steel in his community to generate additional income. As he presently has insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which he will use to purchase a stock of iron and steel to offer for sale. 

Manuel is a patient and industrious person who is determined to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of iron and steel to offer for sale

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly's interest is in cooking different kinds of recipe.Through her interest in cooking, she established her own restaurant. Now she has been running her restaurant for eight years and six months. She is thankful because her husband is supportive in making their restaurant profitable. Melly is a friendly and hard working woman. She is happily married to a farmer and tricycle driver.

Melly's husband is engaged in the transportation business. With their sacrifices and wise management of their restaurant and transportation business, the couple obtains better income, which they invested in their rice field and in buying their single motor and motorcycle transport. With the success she obtains, Melly still hopes for continuous improvement. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy ingredients, vegetables, soft drinks and raw meat such as pork, chicken and beef for her restaurant business. She hopes that through this loan she requested, she can keep her restaurant profitable and ensure satisfaction for all her valued customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, vegetables, soft drinks and raw meat such as pork,chicken and beef for her restaurant business

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, age 25, lives in a small village in the Samtredia district with his mother Madona. Together, they run an agricultural business. They have one milk cow and sell cheese locally. They also have a greenhouse, where they grow cucumbers and greens. In addition, Zurab owns a plot of agricultural land, which contains 180 nut trees. He and his mother sell the harvested products locally at a good price. 

Zurab has requested a loan in order to build a new greenhouse. With this investment, he will be able to sow more vegetables, thus increasing the income of the family. This will allow them to improve their living conditions. 

Zurab is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 36 years old  and comes from Gaza. He is married and has three children. He owns a workshop for the manufacture of stone blocks. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a machine for die-casting stones.

Ahmad hopes that this loan will help him increase his production and thus improve his income to provide his children with better education and his family with a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy a machine for die-casting stones.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fresh fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for fresh fish she needs in her business. The more fish displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Nurmuhamed

texts.ru: Нурмухамед 55 лет, женат, имеет четырех детей. Дети все взрослые и трое живут отдельно, лишь внуки живут с дедушкой. Супруга Нурмухамеда помогает по хозяйству, внуки и дети помогают активно. В 1991 году после развала СССР, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Нурмухамед начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Нурмухамед, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов и насчитывает три головы коровы, пять голов коз и одну лошадь. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Нурмухамеду женить детей. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Нурмухамед обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 жеребцов. В планах - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – накопить сумму на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Nurmuhamed is 55 years old, married, and has four children.  His children are all grown, and three live separately outside the home.  Nurmuhamed's wife works in the home and his children actively help out as well.  While searching for a source of income in 1991 after the Soviet Union collapsed, Nurmuhamed started his own business with 10,000 KGS, working with livestock.    Thanks to his tenacity and perseverance, today his business brings in around 15,000 KGS each month from the sale of diary and meat products, and he now has three head of cattle, five goats, and one horse.  The income from his business allowed Nurmhamed to marry off his children.  With the goal of further increasing the number among his livestock, Nurmuhamed has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy two horses.  He plans to use his profits to expand the number of his livestock even further as well as to save for his youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase two horses for family business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 20-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has been operating her 'sari-sari' store (variety store) business for two years now. She sells a variety of goods, snacks and soft drinks. She usually earns 4,000 Php every month. This is the source of her income.

Deborah is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like biscuits, snacks, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, sugar, milk and other goods. Through this loan,she will be able to buy such items and display them in her store to catch the attention of the customers in her community.

In the future, Deborah hopes to expand her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy more merchandse to sell like biscuits, snacks, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a carpenter. He operates a carpentry workshop in Muhoro village on the outskirts of the town of Kagadi. He started the business in 2009 after acquiring the knowledge from his employer and realizing that there was a high demand for furniture in the area. This is his primary source of income, although at times he is also involved in the sale of agricultural products. His primary challenge is limited business capital, which makes it difficult to meet the demand for furniture in the market.

Godfrey and his wife have four children, ages three, five, eight and 10. The three eldest are enrolled in school. 
 
Godfrey is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings, which he will use to buy timber for his carpentry business. This will allow him to meet the increasing demand in the market. 

His dream is to expand his workshop to train youths in his village as well as eventually providing employment for them.

loans.use: to buy timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 37 years old, married and has two children who are attending school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alita has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetic supplies for her beauty parlor.

Alita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is a 43-year-old hardworking lady. She is married to John, a Kenya navy officer. They are blessed with three children, ages 15, 17, and 19. All of their children attend school. Their major monthly expenditure is school fees. Nelius is operating a business of selling water. She has requested a loan amounting to 40,000 KES to buy a bigger water tank since her customer base has grown significantly. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a bigger water tank

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Гулнара с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется развитое хозяйство, ежемесячная прибыль с продажи молока и перепродажи скота составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 голов молодых бычков и 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность женить в ближайшем будущем своего  сыновей и выдать замуж дочку.
texts.en: Gulnara is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  Since 1995, Gulnara has worked with livestock, having started her business with an initial sum of 10,000 KGS.   Thanks to her hard work, the business has developed under Gulnara's care.  She now brings in around 10,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk, and the reselling of cattle.  With the goal of further growth, Gulnara has turned to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy five head of cattle and one dairy cow.  With the profits from the loan, Gulnara plans to increase the number of domestic animals among her livestock in order to have the opportunity to marry off her sons and daughter in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase 5 bulls and 1 milk cow

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей  38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. С ранних лет она имела большой интерес шитью женской одежды. Повзрослев, она научилась у одной опытной портнихи данному ремеслу и всегда шила одежду для своей семьи. Так как ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, и не отправляет достаточно средств, Мавзуна решила реализовать свое ремесло в бизнес и таким путем обеспечить свою семью. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она готова организовать бизнес и предоставить хороший сервис своим клиентам. Жена ее брата будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она нуждается новых швейных машинок (швейная и вышивальная), но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  12000 сомони для покупки новых швейных машинок. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is an experienced seamstress and creates masterpieces of Tajik national dress. She is 38 years old. She is married and is raising three children. 

From an early age, she had a big interest in sewing women's clothes. Growing up, she learned this craft from an experienced seamstress and always sewed clothes for her family. Since her husband went to Russia and is not able to send enough money, Mavzuna decided to exercise her craft in a business and in this way to provide for her family. 

With this aim, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She is ready to establish a business and to provide good service to her customers. Her brother's wife will help her in running the business. She needs new sewing machines (one for sewing, another for embroidery), but does not have the money. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 somoni to buy new sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for organizing a new business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four children and only three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of brewing and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of millet and cassava flour.  

Josephine works from her home seven days a week and sells to all categories of people, retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of producing local brew on a large scale and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet and cassava flour

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, detergent and other groceries.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  is a single mother with three children and two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business selling cold drinks like passion fruit juice, mineral water and sodas. She has been in this business for two years selling to all categories of people, on a retail basis only. She works at the market seven days out of every week.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of mineral water, crates of sodas, bags of passion fruit and sugar.  

Annet's major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She is aspiring of opening another branch at the market selling cold drinks and also wants to build rental rooms.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for  utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mineral water, crates of sodas, sugar and bags of passion fruit

loans.name: Zebokhon

texts.ru: Зебохону 32 года. Она женщина, которая посвятила свою жизнь своему единственному ребенку. Она разведена и обеспечивает своего ребенка одна. У Зебохона нет высшего образования, чтобы она могла бы работать в престижной организации, и получить хорошую зарплату. Она не согласилась стать горничной или официанткой, так как такие работы ей не по душе. Для нее было большой радостью, обучится в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. От данного курса она научилась много новому о бизнесе и написала свой бизнес план. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей женской и детской одежды, так как этот вид бизнеса имеет большой спрос среди населения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Zebokhon is 32 years old. She is a woman who has devoted her life to her only child. She is divorced and provides for the child alone. 

Zebokhon does not have a higher education, such that she could work in a prestigious organization and earn a good salary. She did not agree to become a maid or a waitress, because such work was not to her liking. For her it was a great joy to take a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. From this course, she learned a lot of new things about business and wrote her own business plan. Now, she is fully able to establish her own business and to become successful in this sphere. She wants to start a business buying and selling women's and children's clothing, as this type of business has high demand among the population. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy goods to establish a new business. This loan will help her to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Gloria Magdalena

texts.es:
Gloria nació en Guayaquil, tiene 35 años. Comenzó su negocio hace 8 años (2005) trabajando en una empresa de venta de electrodomésticos , pero con un préstamo familiar; decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de productos Yanbal, poco a poco creció,  en la actualidad recibe premios por sus ventas.

La clienta trabaja desde las seis de la mañana, va a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y comienza el recorrido a sus clientes para vender los productos requeridos.

No tiene dificultad alguna en su negocio y con la ayuda de Dios va progresando día a día, es soltera tiene dos hijos uno de 6 y el otro de 2 años de edad y solo uno está en escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar perfumes, bisuteria, cremas para poder tener mas vairadad de productos para sus clientes. El sueño o la meta que quiere obtener es de realizar la entrega de su mercadería a otros lugares mas distantes.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in Guayaquil, and she is 35 years old.  She started her business 8 years ago (in 2005).  She was working for a company that sold household appliances, but with a loan from a relative, she decided to start up her own business selling Yanbal products.  The business gradually grew, and now she gets prizes for her sales.

Gloria starts to work at 6 in the morning.  She goes to take her children to school, and then starts travelling around to her customers to sell the products that are in demand.

She doesn't have any problems with her business, and with the help of God, she is making progress each day.  She is single and has 2 children aged 6 and 2, one of whom is attending public school.

With this loan, she wants to buy perfumes, accessories, and creams so that she can have a greater variety of products for her customers.  Her dream, or rather the goal she wants to accomplish, is to sell her merchandise in other, more distant, places.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, accessories and creams

loans.name: Uwazi Na Ukeli Group

texts.en:
Asifa, who is in her early thirties, is married with two boys who are in school. For a period of four years now, Asifa has been managing her life by running a beauty salon and she says that it is a good business to be in. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and she is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans to buy more salon equipment, a cupboard for clothes, a fridge and a plot of land, where, in the future, she wants to have a house. She also used the previous loans to pay school fees. Asifa has paid back all of her loans successfully. She is requesting a loan to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to buy modern salon dryers and a deep freezer.

Asifa will share this loan with her loan group, "Uwazi Na Ukeli", which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is 54 years old. She is a divorcee and has two children. Marhamat has had a difficult life as her husband married another woman and doesn’t help her with the children's expenses. 

Marhamat works hard to earn a living. Her children don’t work as her daughter studies at the university and her son studies at a school. Her daughter is a first-year student at Tajikistan State University in Politics and Business. Marhamat must pay her daughter’s tuition but her income from selling apricots is small. Also, she works at the Zoo and has small salary. She is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s tuition

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 54 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. 

Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens. She has been raising chickens for two years and also earns additional income from farming rice. Alma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
This is Jenny, 42, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a vendor, and she is a mother to their children. Jenny, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. Jenny has been in this business for 23 years now.

Jenny operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells it for a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Jenny earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Jenny is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise such as jackets, shirts, and polos for men and women to expand her product inventory.

Jenny hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise such as jackets, shirts, and polos for men and women which are needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's vegetables selling business.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four. She owns a tea tree farming business. She also has an agricultural farm, growing maize, beans, potatoes, etc., on a small scale, and raising cattle.

She learnt about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group, and she joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is a lack of water.

Zipporah is applying for a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her agricultural business. Her future plan, in five years time, is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is 45 years old. She lives in Gurjaani District with her husband and two daughters (18 and 14 years old). Natasha has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for her family business start-up without any success. Her loan request has been rejected many times because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Natasha’s husband who works locally as a watchman. The family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance from the local government. 

Natasha is requesting a loan from Credo to re-start-up her family business that she had to stop due to financial problems. She will use her loan to purchase pigs to start an animal husbandry business. She will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. Natasha's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Natasha's new business initiative, financed with her Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 32 years old and lives in the Samtredia district. She lives with her husband and two sons. Nana’s husband works as a truck driver and earns a monthly income. The family runs a dairy farm with two calves and three milk cows whose milk is used for cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides this, Nana grows nuts on the family-owned land and sells, on average, 700-800 kg of nuts per year, as well as laurel leaves. In addition, she owns two pigs and sells 20-25 piglets per year.

Nana is a hardworking young woman who is responsible and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness toward others. 

She requested a loan to purchase chicks and start poultry farming. Nana will raise the chicks and then sell the hens at a good price. She considers her business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a 22-year-old man and a resident of Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Arnel is asking for a loan to pay for the renewal of his driver's license and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle. In the future, Arnel hopes to make his business a success and plans on exploring other ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of his driver's license.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and has one infant child. She owns and manages a small variety store in her community to help her husband in earning income. She aims to improve her business and make it more profitable in order to generate sufficient income. 

To improve the business, Melanie is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of snack foods, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soaps, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to make more improvements to her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soaps, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is applying for a subsequent loan after her previous loan was successful. She is grateful for her previous loan, which has helped her grow her business. Bibi has now decided to expand her business to include poultry. She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to help her buy poultry chicks and build a house for them.

loans.use: to help her buy poultry chicks and build a house for them

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. She owns a tea tree farming business. She also has an agricultural farm, dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc., on a small scale.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is a lack of water.

Salome is applying for a loan of 24,846 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan in five years time is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 31 years old. She lives in a small village in the Gardabani District with her husband and in-laws. Lia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Lia produces cheese and sells locally at a good price. Besides, her mother-in-law works as a sales lady at a local grocery shop. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Lia requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved. With the credit Lia will sell clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and then resell it at higher prices among her villagers. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella: 59, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Angelo, a pensioner, and is mother to their children. Estrella, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estrella operates a room rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estrella dreams of having more apartments for rent and hopes to deepen her relationship with God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week: there, she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance of her rental room.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 33 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has three children. Abdullah has owned a poultry farm since 2007 and he has one employee.

Abdullah asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a a new heating network. He hopes that this loan will help him improve the quality of his product and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a a new heating network

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for ten years. Kadzo is a married mother of five children, two of whom are grown ups and the youngest two of whom are in school. The family also earns some income from rental houses.

Kadzo was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase more stock of charcoal and fuel wood for resale. She will pay for her children’s school fees from the extra income she earns as a result of this loan.

Despite the challenge of high transportation costs, Kadzo believes her business has a future and, in addition to earning income to educate her children, she looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal and fuel wood for resale.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for 10 years. Naima is a married mother of five children, two are grown-ups and only the last two are school-going. The family also earns some income from rental houses.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood for sale. She will pay for her children’s school fees from the extra income. 

Despite the challenge of the high cost of transportation and the occasional lack of fuel wood stock, Naima believes the business has a future. Besides getting the income to educate her children, she looks forward to setting up a farming business/project in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood for sale.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba  est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle pratique une double activité commerciale de vente de fruit local (orange, pommes, bananes etc.)  et  d’habits de  friperie. Elle a une expérience de  plus de 30ans dans son activité commerciale. Elle est  membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. C’est dans le souci de vouloir élargir et  développer son activité de  commerce qu’elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 120.000 francs CFA.son intention est de démarrer la commercialisation de jus de fruits. Avec   l’accroissement de ses bénéfices, elle souhaite  contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie  et du bien être de sa famille. Son désir le plus ardent est de devenir dans le futur une grande commerçante  qui voyage a travers le monde pour les besoins de son activité.
texts.en:
Dieynaba is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has two businesses: selling local fruit (oranges, apples, bananas, etc.), and selling second-hand clothing. She has more than 30 years’ experience in these businesses. 

Dieynaba is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches. As she wanted to expand and develop her retail business, she has requested a loan of 120,000 francs CFA. Her plan is to start selling fruit juices. With the growth in her profits, she would like to contribute to improving her family’s living conditions and wellbeing. Dieynaba’s biggest wish for the future is to become a successful retailer, traveling all over the world for the needs of her business.

loans.use: To buy local fruit and second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Provia

texts.en:
Provia is 35 years old and married with four children. She is an agriculturalist who majors in banana and coffee growing. 

Provia started the project in 1996 with one acre of coffee, but currently she owns two acres of coffee and bananas. She has achieved a lot from the yields, like constructing a permanent house for her family and sending three of her children to school.

Provia wants a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy fertilizers for her banana and coffee plantations. This will enable her to realize high yields to support her family with the basic necessities of life. Her major challenge is the decline in soil fertility to support coffee-growing on a large scale. 

Provia’s dream is to see all her children graduating from university and getting good jobs. She is a hardworking and resilient lady.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Ganira

texts.en:
Ganira is 60 years old. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson in a small village in the Gardabani district. Ganira has a dairy business. She has milk cows and calves and sells dairy products locally at a good price. In addition, she makes pies and sells them from her home. Ganira is a very hard-working woman and does her best to improve the living conditions of her family. 

Ganira requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing additional calves, she will increase her production of dairy products. This will improve the income of her family. With increased income, Ganira will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from the village of Martkopi in Gardabani District. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband, three children, daughter-in-law, and grandchildren. Mariam’s elder daughter works as a pharmacist and the younger is a saleslady at a local store. Both of them earn small monthly salaries. In addition, Mariam’s husband works as an artisan and Mariam is a shop assistant.  The family runs a small dairy farm as well. They have a milk cow and sell milk to the village.

Mariam is requesting a loan to expand the family's agro-business. In particular, she will buy piglets and food for them. After the piglets are grown, in four or five months, they will be sold at a higher price. The additional profits earned by the family will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and lives in a small village of the Sagarejo district with her husband and mother-in-law. Karina is pregnant. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has 2 milk cows and a buffalo. They produce yogurt and sell it locally at a good price. Besides this, her husband sells wood to earn income.

Karina is a very hard working young woman. She requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will be properly fattened. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children. The major monthly expenditure is fees as her children all are in school. 

She is a hard-working business lady who owns a clothes stall where she sells clothes for adults and children. She has been in this business for more than two years and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her customers and income.

She has requested a loan of ksh.50,000 to buy two bundles of clothes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of clothes

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Саидчону 20 лет. Он живет с родителями в городе Дангара. Саидчон c юного возраста начал зарабатывать на жизнь. Он изучил ремесло по изготовлению окон и дверей. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 3 года и является мастером своего дела. Саичон энергичный и предприимчивый молодой человек. Он берет кредит для приобретения лесоматериалов с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Saidjon is twenty years old and lives with his parents in the city of Dangara.  He began earning a living from a young age.  He studied the craft of door and window making and has been in this line of work for three years.  He is a master of the craft.  Saidjon is an energetic and enterprising young man.  He's taking out a loan in order to purchase timber to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Jabor

texts.ru: Джабор проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и у него шестеро детей. Джабор занимается растениеводством более 8 лет. У него собственная земля, где он выращивает пшеницу. Одновременно он работает на стройке вместе со старшим сыном. Джабор берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян. Он хочет получить богатый урожай и хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Jabor is 48 years old and lives in the Muminobod region of Tajikistan.  He's married and has six children.  Jabor has worked in agriculture for more than eight years.  He has his own land where he grows wheat.  At the same time, he works on construction with his oldest son.  Jabor is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.  He wants to have a bountiful harvest and good profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años de edad. Ella vive junto a su mamá y  su hija. Se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, panes con pollo, hamburguesas, refrescos, etc. Su negocio es muy conocido y tiene mucha clientela ya que esta a orilla de la calle en una ramada tiene que caminar como un kilómetro desde su casa hasta donde tiene su puesto de venta. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para terminar de construir su casa. Así, si hija vivirá más segura, cómoda y más higiénica lo mismo que su madre y ella. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la situación financiera de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old. She is the single mother of a 4 year old daughter. She lives with her mother and her daughter. She makes and sells stuffed tortillas, Salvadoran chicken sandwiches, hamburgers, soft drinks, etc. Her business is very well known and she has many clients as she is next to a roadside in a branch covered shelter. She has to walk about a kilometer from her house to the sales stall.

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy supplies to finish building her home. And so, her daughter will be safer, more comfortable and healthier, as well as her mother and herself. Her desire is to expand her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to finish building her home

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 44 years old and lives with her husband, together with her three children, aged 20, 16, and 10, who are all still in school. 

Mwanajuma is a hardworking business lady who owns a charcoal stall in which she sells charcoal and firewood.  She has operated this business for more than three years, and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her customers and income range.

She is very dedicated to her work, she is energetic, and she has many goals for the future. Her secret of success is consistency and a love of the work. 

Mwanajuma has approached us for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy 40 sacks of charcoal

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Clydie

texts.en:
Clydie is 39 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rug making.

Clydie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Clydie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rug making.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 66 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in a small village of Gardabani District. Tina is provided with a retirement pension. Besides this, she runs a small poultry farm and has hens, ducks and turkeys. Tina sells eggs in her village.

Along with the above-mentioned sources of income, she is also involved in the flower-trading business. She purchases flowers at wholesale prices and resells them for a profit. Tina requested credit to expand the flower business. She will purchase flower seeds and cultivate the land in her yard where she will sow different kinds of flowers. Tina will grow flowers throughout the entire year and will be able to reduce the cost of the flowers. This will significantly increase Tina’s income and she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to grow flowers in her yard.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат жительница района Муминобод. Ей 41 год. Она замужем и воспитывает семерых детей. Ее сыновья работают за рубежом. Сама Шарофат занимается вышиванием национальных женских одежд уже 5 лет. Она принимает заказы у себя дома. Шарофат запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 TJS, для приобретения швейной машины. За счет прибыли Шарофат хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Sharofat lives in the Muminobod region of Tajikistan.  She's 41 years old, married, and is raising seven children.  Her sons work abroad.  Sharofat herself has been engaged in the embroidery of the national women's clothes for five years, working and taking orders from home.  Sharofat is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy a sewing machine.  With her profits, Sharofat wants to expand her operations and increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is still working in the same bank, but that didn't confuse her in concentrating on her business. She even worked on enhancing it by adding new products for sale in her store. 

Rania is now selling housewares besides candles and decoration pieces. She is now applying for another loan to increase the amount she has of kitchenware.

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: as working capital to enable her to place larger orders for clothing

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустаму 31 год. Он женат и имеет одного сына. Рустам единственный кормилец в семье. Он занимается растениеводством и в основном выращивает пшеницу. Он занимается этой деятельностью более 6 лет. Дополнительно Рустам занимается ремонтом жилых домов. Сейчас Рустам запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для посева пшеницы. Он хочет получить богатый урожай и хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Rustam is 31 years old, married, and has one son.  He is the sole breadwinner in the family.  Agriculture is his business and he mostly grows wheat.  He has been in this line of work for more than six years.  Additionally, Rustam works repairing homes.  Now he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for planting wheat.  He wants a bountiful harvest and good profits.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmen Socorro

texts.es: Carmen de 61 años de edad, desde hace 20 años aprendió a ser comerciante; ella vendiendo pequeños artículos entre sus familiares y amigos empezó a construír su propio capital de trabajo;tambien mediante la observación aprendió a desarrollar el arte de la costura de ropa, e inició haciendo vestidos a su pequeño grupo de familia y de amigos, los cuales poco a poco se convirtieron en su mercado principal y llevaron la vocería en materia promocional lo que la ayudó a crear nuevos  nuevos mercados. Muy pronto su negocio fue creciendo y  su capital de trabajo también fue siendo más exigente, para poder responder a la demanda de sus compradores, por eso debió acceder a financiación de su cartera de ventas a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segunda solicitud que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual con una parte  comprará, telas en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos especiales y aumentar su producción de ropa y también comprará con la otra parte de dinero, cremas y perfumería, que su clientela le ha encargado y debe responderle muy oportunamente, para fortalecer su oferta y así hacer del credikiva su mejor y mas exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Carmen is 61 years old and 20 years ago she learned to be a merchant.  She sells small items to her family and friends began building her own working capital. She also learned through observation and developed the skills of a seamstress, so she started making dresses for her small group of family and friends. Gradually, they became her main market and led them to recommend her which helped her to expand her market.  

Her business quickly grew and its need for working capital was also becoming more demanding.  In order to meet the demands of her buyers, she had access to a loan to finance her line of credit.  Currently she applying for a Kiva loan, this will be her second loan through the Santo Domingo Foundation. With a part of the loan she will buy wholesale fabrics to get greater volume discounts and increase production and with the other part of the money she will buy creams and cosmetics. Her customers have placed orders with her and she must respond very promptly to strengthen her offerings and thus make Kiva loan her best and most successful investment.

loans.use: use some of the loan to buy wholesale fabrics and with the other part of the money, she will buy creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a retail shop selling used and new electronics/electricals. The business also carries out electronics repairs. 

She started the business from the income she received from her former employment. Judith also keeps poultry.

Judith learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the bad debts. 

Judith is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy radios, sockets, cables, televisions, etc. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. 

Her desire is also to keep layers (hens) in the near future.

loans.use: to buy radios, sockets, cables, televisions, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, married, and lives in Likoni, Kenya with her husband and her two children. She is very hardworking and is always setting a good example. Their major monthly expenditures are rent and school fee payments.

She owns a clothes stall where she buys and sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for two years now. It has given her good experience and widened her customers' range. She has asked for a loan amounting to KES 25,000 so she can stock her stall and buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.use: to stock her stall and buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 20-year-old single man. He has three brothers. Naser is a university student majoring in hotel management. He is applying for an educational loan that will help him in paying the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена  - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием столовых сортов винограда.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодых саженцев винограда.
Елена с мужем решила приобрести опрыскиватель т.к вручную опрыскивать большую площадь виноградника очень тяжело.
В планах на будущие:  расширить посадку новых сортов винограда, поставить теплицы. 
В личных планах: на будущее достроить дом для жилья.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования опрыскивателя для виноградника.
texts.en: Elena is a farmer.  Since 2010, she has grown different kinds of grapes.  Her husband helps care for the business.    With her husband, Elena decided to buy a sprayer since spraying the crops by hand over a large area is very difficult.  When it comes to the future, Elena plans to start planting new varieties, and to build a greenhouse.  She would also like to build a home.  She needs your help to finance the purchase of a sprayer.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Recently, Sahar’s husband retired and is now receiving a governmental retirement salary, and Sahar is still working in the public sector. 

Previously, Sahar applied for a loan to support her daughter, Nojoud, who is studying at the university. Now she is applying for another loan to continue supporting her daughter and pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 65 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Mchadijvari. She and her husband run a small-scale dairy business; in particular, they produce cheese which they sell locally. The family’s income is supplemented by both the rent they receive from a flat they own in the capital city and her retirement pension.

Rusudan and her life partner work hard to save, but they still don’t have enough money to improve their living conditions. Rusudan is very grateful for Kiva lenders and Credo, as she has been offered a 2000 GEL loan that will allow her to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, bricks, etc. In this way, the couple will be able to build a bathroom for her house.

With this loan Rusudan and her husband will upgrade their home so they can enjoy living in it and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 28 years old, single and has two older sisters. He has a business in which he mainly sews bed covers and curtains. He is applying for a 1000 JOD youth loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ramata  Bouna

texts.fr:
Agée de 32 ans, madame Ramata Bouna fait du commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le cadet, 8 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre du poisson frais. Elle part se ravitailler chez les piroguiers pour venir revendre dans le marché local. Elle se lève tôt vers 6h du matin et à 14h, elle a déjà fini sa journée. Il faut noter que puisqu’elle n’a pas de chambre froide elle fait tout pour vite écouler sa marchandise.
Elle n’a pas de charges familiales sinon ses propres besoins ; son bénéfice est donc reversé dans l’activité. Pour maximiser son profit, elle veut se lancer dans le futur dans la vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
At age 32, Mrs. Ramata Bouna has been in business for five years.  She is the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 15 and the youngest is eight.  Her business is selling fresh fish.   She goes to get her fresh batch from the boatmen and comes back to sell them at the local market.  She gets up early, around 6 am, and by 2 pm she has finished her day.  It should be noted that since she has no refrigerator, she does all she can to move her merchandise quickly.
She has no family responsibilities except her own personal needs; her profits are therefore reinvested in her business. To maximize her profits, she wants to take on cosmetic sales in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Gabriel   tiene 18 años,  se dedica  a la actividad de la carpintería, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Gabriel   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a su trabajo ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ahorrar en pasajes ya que el tener una motocicleta le permitirá ahorra dinero, el  Sr. Gabriel   va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, El Sr. Gabriel   es una persona joven muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 18 years old and works as a carpenter. He lives in the town of El Torno. This loan is his first with the institution.

Gabriel will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which will help him get to work more quickly as he has a long way to travel. He is asking for the loan because having a motorcycle will let him save money on fares. Gabriel will use these savings to buy tools for his work, since those that he has already are getting worn out and need to be replaced so that he can do a better job.

Gabriel is a very hardworking young man and feels happy about the opportunity provided by this loan, since his job is the only activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 53-year-old married woman with two daughters. She operates a sewing business at home to help supplement her family’s income.

Layla is now applying for a 1000 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy more fabric and material. She hopes to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es: Rosa de 57 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, especialmente de uniformes. En sus 37 años de experiencia ha sabido sostener su negocio y con creó la forma de generar  ingresos, con los que desde que formó su propia familia pudo apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. Su idea de negocio  nació después de haber aprendido el oficio, realizando cursos donde aprendió las tareas de corte y confección, iniciando primero, con la fabricación de vestidos infantiles, posterior de quinceañeros y de ropa en general además de arreglos. Hoy su principal producto es el  uniforme  escolar, que comercializa directamente, mediante convenios con instituciones educativas. En su esquema de mercadeo sus instituciones educativas, que son sus principales clientes le adelantan el 50% del costo del número de productos a elaborar, y el otro 50%  una vez entregue la totalidad del contrato.  Rosa también tiene clientes individuales a los que les vende a crédito y sus operaciones las desempeña de lunes a domingos. En la actualidad Rosa ha recibido 9 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha comprado maquinarias, materias primas e insumos, con los cuales ha mejorado sus tiempos productivos, e incrementado su capital de trabajo. Su meta es ampliar su taller, generando más empleos a operarias, para finalmente remodelar su vivienda y lograr con su trabajo persistente, esfuerzo y dedicación todos sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará telas para confeccionar uniformes escolares que tiene encargados y para lo que requiere complementar el otro 50% para dar cumplimento a su contrato de manera oportuna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57 years old, makes clothing, especially uniforms. In her 37 years of experience she has known how to sustain her business and created a way to earn income with which she started her own family and could support the household expenses.

The idea to start her own business was born after she learned the trade, taking courses where she learned tailoring and dressmaking, starting first making children’s clothing, and later for teenagers and clothing in general plus mending.

Today her main product is school uniforms that she sells directly, through contracts with educational institutions. Her marketing arrangement with educational institutions, who are her main customers, is that they advance 50% of the cost of the number of products to be made, and the other 50% when she delivers the entire order.

Rosa also has individual customers to whom she offers credit and her business is done from Monday through Sunday. At the moment Rosa has received 9 loans through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she has bought machines, staples and supplies, with which she has improved her turnaround and increased her working capital.

Her goal is to expand her workshop, creating more jobs for employees, and lastly to remodel her home and to succeed through her persistent work, effort, and dedication to all her dreams.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, in order to buy fabric to make school uniforms for the orders she has which require finishing the other 50% in order to complete the contract in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fabric in larger quantity

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 28 years old and married. She is a philologist, or a linguist who studies written texts. She is a teacher at one of Vanadzor’s schools. Her husband is a physics teacher at another school.

Besides teaching in the local schools, the couple also teaches mathematics and physics privately in the living room of their house. But they find this arrangement too impractical and uncomfortable and are building a new room to be used as a classroom.

Lusine is applying for a 500,000 AMD loan from Nor Horizon to buy a computer and printer plus new desks and chairs for their new classroom. This will help them provide a more comfortable environment for their students and upgrade their enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer plus new desks and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo  tiene 38 años, casado con dos hijos que tienen las edades de 14 y 10 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Pantini, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Reynaldo utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Reynaldo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo is 38 years old, married and has two children, who are 14 and 10 years old. He prepares and sells cheese and milk because he owns cattle. He lives in the town of Patini, where the inhabitants engage in agriculture and livestock raising. This is his first loan cycle in his communal bank. 

Sr. Reynaldo will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity. The reason he is requesting a loan is because he lacks the money to make this purchase and it will greatly benefit him since the cow will provide a good quantity of milk and he will be able to produce more milk and cheese and improve his earnings.

Sr. Reynaldo faces challenges in his business such as fodder, which he needs to buy every now and then and he will use his profits to improve his cattle. He wants to be able to produce cheese wholesale and sell to the different markets in the city of la Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 35-year-old, hardworking lady who is married with two children. She lives in Likoni, Kenya where she has a clothing stall where she sells second hand clothing.
She has operated this business for the last two year. This has helped her gain a lot of experience. She has also been able to get a wide variety of consumers. Her major monthly expense is school payments.
She has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to reinvest in her stall and buy two bundles of second hand clothing. She is grateful for such an opportunity and believes that this will enhance her business hence improving her living standards.

loans.use: to reinvest in her stall and buy two bundles of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 24 años y es casado, el  se dedica a la venta de ganado, el vende en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de  El Alto, el vive en la localidad de Karuiza,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Edwin va a usar este préstamo para la compra un camión para llevar a las distintas ferias su ganado para la venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Edwin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la poca demanda en ocasiones ya sea por problemas de clima o de transporte, desea con el tiempo poder comprar en mayor cantidad ganado.
texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old and married, and works selling livestock. He sells in the different cattle markets in the city of El Alto, and lives in the community of Karuiza. 

This loan is his first with the institution. Edwin will use this loan to buy a truck to bring his livestock to different cattle markets to sell. He is asking for the loan because he needs capital. The challenge that Edwin faces in his business is low demand at times, be it due to problems with the weather or transportation. In time he wants to be able to buy livestock in greater quantities.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 63 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Nakhakhulevi. Both of the family members receive retirement pensions. Nora and her husband are involved in a small scale dairy business. In particular, they own three milk cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. In addition, they grow nuts on family-owned land. According to the government's estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category, and they get monthly social assistance. Nora’s husband works as a watchman and also gets a small monthly salary.
Nora and her life partner work hard to save, but they still don’t have enough income to improve their living conditions. Nora is very grateful for Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron, sand, bricks, etc. She will be able to renovate her house and improve her quality of life. Nora and her husband can create suitable home conditions so that they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 33 años, convive con Freddy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Brayan y Cielo. Su casa es alquilada y se ubica en un anexo agrícola.
Luzmila, a pesar de cuidar a su pequeña hija, no descuida sus labores. Cuando Luzmila tenía 17 años se inició en la agricultura. Ya tenía ciertos conocimientos ya que sus padres se dedican a esta actividad. Sus principales sembríos constan de arvejas, habas,  maíz y demás hortalizas. Con la ayuda de su esposo  puede abarcar todo el trabajo sacrificado que es cuidar sus sembríos. “Bellavista es una zona que produce buenos choclos (maíz tierno) por eso la mayoría de compradores llegan hasta ahí”, comenta orgullosa. Por su parte, Fredy  también se dedica al servicio de transporte entre los distrito de Tarma y Palca. De esa manera pueden abastecer sus gastos principales, y más aún con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Luzmila acaba de cosechar un lote de maíz y le fue bien, espera lo mismo de otros lotes, para ello requiere de su ayuda, para adquirir abono orgánico por esta razon solicitará 600 soles para la compra del mismo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 33 years old, lives with Freddy and has two children, Brayan y Cielo.  She lives in a rented house located in the agricultural zone.

Luzmila, despite caring for her daughter, does not neglect her work.  She was 17 years old when she began farming.  She already had certain knowledge that she learned from her parents who also farmed.  Her main crops are peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  With her husband’s help she is able to do all of her work and care for her crops.  “Bellavista is a zone that produces good choclo (soft corn), so most of the buyers go there,” she proudly states.  Fredy also provides transportation services in and around the Tarma and Palca districts.  In this way they can provide for their main expenses and also for their children’s educational expenses.  Luzmila just finished harvesting a lot of corn and things went well for her.  She expects the same from the other lots and needs your help for that so that she can buy compost.  She is asking for a loan in the amount of 600 PEN.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando es un joven agricultor padre de dos niños, desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, exclusivamnete a la cosecha de café, necesita un crédito de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (¢350.000) para comprar abonos, herbicidas y plaguicidas para darle mantenimiento a su cafetal,de esta manera lo protege de plagas, hongos y otras enfermedades,  Armando nos comenta que del buen mantenimiento que le de a su cafetal depende la producción que obtendrá, por eso hace su mejor esfuerzo por lograrlo.
texts.en: Armando is a young farmer and the father of two children.  He has been farming and exclusively harvesting coffee since he was very young.  He needs a loan in the amount of ¢350,000 to buy compost, herbicides, and blight chemicals to maintain his coffee crop.  In this way he can protect it from blights and other disease.  Armando tells us that his crop’s production depends on the maintenance he give his fields.  This is why he gives maximum effort.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

location.town: El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
