James is a 48-year-old Ugandan citizen who works as a primary school teacher. He is married with five children who live in Buyanja-Rukungiri District. He is a responsible and hard-working man doing self-sustaining and self-empowerment activities. Unfortunately there are is a lack of finance in his home as a result of increased standards of living due to inflation and also the unreliable climatic conditions which have affected his side income which comes from an agricultural production; growing coffee and bananas.

Due to a lack of money for school fees, his children could no longer attend school. James joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI)- Rukungiri Branch in 2012 to get financial assistance in order to improve his standards of living. 

With this financial assistance, he has managed to put all his children in school. James is able to do this through his hard work in his teaching job and at home in the gardens. The loan will be used to pay tuition fees for his two children who are attending secondary education.

James is thankful for the assistance that UGAFODE Microfinance Limited MDI and its financial service partners have provided to people with scarce resources and to poor communities like Buyanja so that they have an opportunity to obtain a decent and sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Rehem

texts.en:
Rehem is aged 33. She is married with seven children aged between two and 16 years. Five of them attend schools. She owns a butcher shop and has been in the business for 11 years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more meat to sell in the butcher shop. With the profits from the business, she wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Everline is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Tumaini Group members. The 10 of them, 9 women and 1 man, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Everline joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Everline joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Everline described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Everline’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To cultivate a large quantities of rice for resale.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is widowed; she has four children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her older sisters). She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for seven years.  

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and threads. She generates additional income through selling Dynapharm and Tianshi health products. She works in a shop six day a week and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges including seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to employ three girls to assist her in the tailoring and to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Obuyanzi Group

texts.en:
Obuyanzi is a group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Dorcas. The group has 11 women and 4 men. Dorcas is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Dorcas joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Dorcas joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Dorcas reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2.5 bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 12 bags per acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to invest in cows and perhaps invest in another business too. Dorcas’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Venutse

texts.en:
Venuste is aged 41. He is married to woman who works in health center. They have three children, all enrolled in different schools. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more fruits to sell. He has been in the business of fruit for the past three years. With the profits from the business, paying school fees for his children is the priority.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 33 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past five years. She is married to a house-builder and together they have three children. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more green beans and eggplants to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more green beans and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Nyonje Group

texts.en:
Everline is a member of Nyonje Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 15 women and 2 men. Everline is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Everline first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Everline joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Everline described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Everline’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old. She is married with one child. She owns a restaurant which she has been running for the past eight months. 

She has requested a loan to buy more equipment such as a refrigerator and sodas to sell in the restaurant. The profits that will be obtained will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sodas to sell and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a father of one child. He is married to a businesswoman. He sells bed sheets and towels. He will use the profits from the business to build his house.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and towels to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old. She is a mother of two children aged 18 and 20 years. They both attend school. She owns a restaurant and has been running the business for 13 years. 

She wants the loan to buy more food stuffs to sell. She wants to use the profits to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is aged 32, and has two children. She sells different items such as sodas and beers in her bar. 

She would like to request a loan to boost her business by adding more drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 28 years old. She sells various items in her boutique. She sells sugar, rice and utensils in her business which she has been running for one year. 

She is planing to buy more sugar, rice and utensils to sell. With the profits from the business, she is determined to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is aged 42. She is married with seven children. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for five years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more eggplants, peas, and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Livingstone is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Ushindi Group members. The 13 of them, 10 women and 3 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Livingstone joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Livingstone joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Livingstone was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 5 bags per ½ acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Livingstone’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Mbukwe Group

texts.en:
Johnstone is a member of Mbukwe Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 19 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 7 men. Johnstone is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Johnstone first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Johnstone joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and access inputs on time.

Johnstone described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair his home and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Johnstone’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 9.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 38 años, es contadora Pública hace más de 15 años. Está casada con el Sr Ulises hace diez años de los cuales tuvieron dos hijos.
Comenta que empezó desde muy abajo que le costó mucho para abrir su estudio contable y gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su marido ya tienen una oficina muy bien equipada. Además nos dice que su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan crecer y ser profesionales para que el día de mañana sea útil para ella y para la sociedad. 
La misma agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de crédito que le esta brindando, por la confianza puesta  en su persona y dice que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la remodelación de su oficina, la cual es su medio de poder trabajar y ofrecer así un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and has been a public accountant for more than 15 years.  She has been married to Ulises for ten years and together they have two children.  She says that she started right at the bottom and it was hard work to open her own accountancy firm but thanks to her and her husband's efforts they now have a well-equipped office.  Moreover, she tells us that her biggest dream is for her children to grow up and become professionals so that one day they will be useful for her and for society.

Antonia is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity of a loan and for the trust being put in her.  She says she is applying for this loan to invest in remodeling her office, where she is able work and offer a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to remodel the office.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa propia con sus padres en la ciudad de Paraguarí, no tiene  hijos, es cobrador desde hace más de 4 años, a partir del crédito que quitó de Fundación quiere empezar a trabajar por sí mismo como macatero y no para otro, ya que cuenta  con clientela formada y se lo conoce por casi todas las zonas donde trabajaba como cobrador.
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de productos en general, como ser frazadas, sabanas, edredones y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus padres con los gastos del día a día.
texts.en:
Victor is 25 years old.  He is single and lives in his parents' house in the city of Paraguarí.  He does not have children and has been a conductor for more than four years.  With the loan from Fundación Paraguya he wants to be self-employed as a street vendor.  He already has a customer base and he is known in all the areas where he works as a conductor.

He is applying for this loan to buy general products, such as sheets, blankets, quilts and such like.  With these he will be able to continue working and helping his parents will day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, quilts and such like.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana tiene 22 años, es soltera tiene un hijo de un 11 meses, se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general que le va muy bien, debido a que cuenta con cancha de vóley en su casa, ya cuenta  con clientela formada, es muy admirada por sus vecinos por ser una joven muy trabajadora que además está cursando el último año de enfermería.
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general, con lo cual podrá seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados y también seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Yohana is 22 years old.  She is single and has an eleven month old son.  She makes a living selling drinks.  This is going very well for her as she has a volleyball court at her house and she has regular customers.  She is much admired by her neighbours as she is so young and very hardworking.  She is also in her final year of studying nursing.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy drinks.  With this she will be able to continue to provide her customers with the variety of drinks which they are used to and she will be able to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame Ramata, une dame de 33 ans, fait de la vente de légumes depuis 4 ans. Ramata est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont le tout dernier qui n’a que 8 mois lui a empêché de travailler pendant un bon bout de temps. Elle commence sa journée à 6h pour finir à 13h et pouvoir retourner s’occuper de ses enfants.
C’est sa 1ère expérience de crédit et elle demande 100000F CFA pour au moins avoir une grande quantité de légumes à revendre. Elle a un projet, celui d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Ramata, a 33-year-old woman, has been selling vegetables for four years. She is married and a mother of four children. Her youngest child is only eight months old, and so she has only returned to work recently.

She starts her day at six a.m., and finishes at 1 p.m, after which she goes home to take care of her children. 

This is her first loan experience and she is asking for 100,000 francs CFA to buy a large quantity of vegetables that she will resell. She hopes to open a small general store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Julienne Evelyne

texts.fr: Julienne est une femme de 40 ans mariée, mère de 06 enfants tous scolarisés. elle a installé un comptoir a son domicile d'ou elle vend des friandises et le bois chauffant depuis 14 ans. son activité est stable mais il ya de cela 06 mois on a volé sa marchandise et elle sollicite un pret pour ré -lancer son activité. ce crédit va augmenter son stock. ainsi le bénéfice tiré sera utilisé pour assurer le bien etere de sa famille ainsi que sa capacité d'auto financement.
texts.en: Julienne is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children who have all been to school. She set up a counter at her house where she has been selling snacks and fire wood for 14 years. This business is stable, but six months ago her merchandise was stolen. So, she is asking for a loan to re-start her business. This loan is going to increase her stock and the income will be used to ensure the well-being of her family as well as her capacity for self-financing.

loans.use: to buy snacks and firewood

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr: Emile est un camerounais de 28 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il possède et gère une alimentation dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans où il vend des produits alimentaires, biscuits, bonbons, détergents, etc. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses profits. les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition, logement, santé..)
texts.en: Emile is a 28-year-old Cameroonian, who is married and a father of two children. He owns and has been managing a food shop in one of the town's neighborhoods for two years, where he sells food products, cookies, candy, laundry  detergent, etc. He is asking for this loan to increase his stock of merchandise in order to increase his sales and profits. The income earned will be reinvested in his business and will also help support the needs of his family (food, housing, health...).

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone credit

loans.name: Edwige Larissa

texts.fr: Edwige est une femme de 25 ans, célibataire et mère de 01 enfant. elle a un petit stand de vente de vivres secs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans qu'elle gère avec serieux. Elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des marchandises telles que les arachides, savon, huiles, etc.. pour pouvoir satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle mais aussi accroitre ses revenus. le benéfice tiré de ce prêt lui permettra d'agrandir son activité avec le temps, de subvenir à ses besoins, mais aussi aux besoins grandisssants de son enfant
texts.en:
Edwige is a 25-year-old woman, single, and a mother of one child. She has a small stand where she has been selling dried foods in one of the town's neighborhoods for two years. She is a serious business manager. 

She is asking for a loan to buy goods such as peanuts, soap, oil, etc. to be able to not only satisfy her customers but also to increase her sales. 

The income generated from this loan will allow her to expand her business over time, support her needs, and also the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 69 years old. She owns a beauty salon. She has been in this business only for a few months, but she expects much from it. She has applied for a loan to buy more equipment, such as hood dryers, scissors and hair clippers, to use in her salon. She plans to use the profits she earns to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy hood dryers, scissors and hair clippers to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Fatima Ama

texts.en: Fatima Ama sells banku (corn and cassava dough) in Ebubonko near Abura. She also sells a traditional okra stew that is a local favorite. She has received a middle-school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver in their community. Fatima Ama has been selling banku and okra stew for the past years. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to prepare her banku, as well as the ingredients needed for her stew. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her food-selling enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare banku dough, as well as ingredients needed for her okra stew, for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 27 years old. She sells charcoal and has spent eight years in this business. She is married to a house builder, and they have three children. With her loan, she will buy more charcoal to sell. The profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte Ama

texts.en: Charlotte Ama sells beverages in Ebubonko near Abura. She has received a vocational school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a miner. Charlotte Ama has been selling beverages for the past 10 years. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity and variety of beverages for sale at her shop. She hopes to use the new profits to develop her beverage sales business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of beverages for sale at her shop.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is a baker in Ebubonko near Abura. Agatha has received a middle-school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a supervisor at a local business. Agatha has been a baker for the past 15 years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients needed for her bakery. She hopes to use the new profits to grow her bakery shop to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients needed for her bakery.

loans.name: Hawastata

texts.en:
Hawastata is single and has one child; she has received schooling through a middle school level. 

Hawastata sells clothes in Ebubonko near Abura, which she has done for the past ten years. She uses her income to support herself and her child. 

Hawastata will use the loan to buy more material and supplies for the clothing she makes. With the new profits from her business, Hawastata plans to expand her clothing sales shop.

loans.use: to buy more material and supplies needed to make clothing.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza sells yams in Ebubonko near Abura; she has not received a formal education.  She is married, and has five children. 

Adiza has been selling yams for 20 years. She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees, and other general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of yams to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of yams to sell in the market.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Remedios Group

texts.es:
Virgen de los remedios es el grupo de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, que se unieron con ganas de querer salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares e hijos por medio del trabajo de cada una de ellas, son mujeres que pese a todo lo que han luchado quieren seguir haciéndolo.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Gertrudis, quien vende todo tipo de alimentos, y gracias a esto está saliendo adelante. Es una persona con muchas ansias de salir adelante y quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.  Su meta es algún dia poder tener un gran copetín y seguir haciendo comidas.
Pide esta ayuda para poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende y así seguí ayudando a su familia y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
"Virgen de los Remedios" is a group of seventeen women from the city of Caacupé, who united with the goal of achieving success and helping their families and children by way of their work. They are women who, despite everything they have fought, want to continue fighting.

One of these women is Gertrudis, who sells various types of food products. Thanks to this, she is moving forward. She is a woman with the desire to get ahead in life, and she wants to help her family through her work. Her goal is to have a large fast food counter one day and to continue making food.

She is applying for a loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other goods to continue making the food products which she sells. In this way, she will continue helping her family and growing as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other goods.

loans.name: Rebecca Esi

texts.en:
Rebecca Esi, a baker in Ebubonko near Abura, received no formal education. Married to a driver and the mother of two, she is responsible for paying her children's school fees.

Rebecca Esi has been selling baked bread for the past 10 years. She has requested this loan to buy an increased quantity of supplies and ingredients to make bread to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of supplies and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a hairdresser in Ebubonko near Abura. She has received no formal education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. 

Araba has been a hairdresser for the past 5 years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other general family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more creams, weaves, wigs, hair relaxers and other supplies and products demanded by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy more creams, weaves, wigs, hair relaxers, and other supplies and products demanded by her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells jewelry in Ebubonko near Abura. She has received a middle school education.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Elizabeth has been selling jewelry for 10 years. She is responsible for paying her family's general expenses alongside her husband. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased quantity and variety of jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her jewelry shop further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is single and has no children. She has received schooling through middle school. She is a hairdresser in Ebubonko near Abura and has done this kind of work for the past 10 years. Vivian uses her income to support herself and pays all her own expenses. She will use the loan to buy more creams, weaves, wigs, hair relaxers, and other supplies and products demanded by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to expand her hair salon further.

loans.use: to buy more creams, weaves, wigs, hair relaxers, and other supplies and products demanded by her customers.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a member of the group called Trabajando hacia el futuro (Working to the future), located in the city of Samana. This is his seventh loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over four years, started from his savings.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Vicente realized the need to improve his home, and with the business profits he saved and this housing loan he will change his house walls from wood to concrete blocks, for which he is requesting this loan. He will also purchase other necessary materials. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan, to start with the house construction.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their houses at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Vicente, a single man with three children, is also a micro-entrepreneur conducting fuel sales. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth Aba

texts.en: Elizabeth Aba is divorced and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. She sells the corn dough, ga kenkey, in Ebubonko near Abura and has been selling her kenkey recipe for 1 year now. She uses her income to support herself and pay her children's school fees. Elizabeth Aba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to grow her kenkey business. (Kenkey is fermented ground maize used for making dumplings or bread.)

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Elizabeth Ekua

texts.en: Elizabeth Ekua is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. She sells local bread in Ebubonko near Abura, which she has done for the past 5 years. Her husband is a mason. Elizabeth Ekua uses her income to help her husband pay their family's general expenses. She will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of supplies and ingredients needed to prepare her bread. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her bread selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of supplies and ingredients needed to prepare her bread.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells provisions in Ebubonko near Abura. Cecilia has received no formal education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an accountant. Cecilia has been selling provisions for 20 years. She is responsible for helping to support her husband pay their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her provision sales further and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi is married and has 5 children. She has received no formal education. Asi sells cassava in Ebubonko near Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a factory worker. Asi uses her income to help pay her children's school fees and other family expenses. She will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to increase her capital base to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Agnes Aba

texts.en: Agnes Aba sells rice and soap in Ebubonko near Abura. She has received no formal education.  She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver. Agnes Aba has been selling rice and soap for 3 years now. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the general utility bills of the family. Her loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of rice and soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед житель города Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и живет вместе с родителями. У него среднее образование. Чамшед занимается животноводством в течение 5 лет. Он покупает крупно-рогатый скот и после откорма перепродает его. Чамшед запрашивает кредит на сумму 3,500 TJS для закупа коров и телят. За счет прибыли он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. He is 30 years old. He is married and lives together with his parents. He has a high school education.

Jamshed has been engaged in livestock breeding for a period of 5 years. He purchases cattle and resells them after fattening them. Jamshed requests a loan in the amount of 3,500 TJS for the purchase of cows and calves. From the income he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Azizbek

texts.ru: Азизбеку 33 года. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Азизбек единственный кормилец в семье. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Азизбек берет кредит для закупа коров и телят. На полученную прибыль он планирует расширить свой бизнес и тем самым улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Azizbek is 33 years old. He and his family live in the city of Istaravshan in the Zafarobod region. Azizbek is the only wage-earner in the family. He earns a living through buying and reselling cattle.

Azizbek takes a loan for the purchase of cows and calves. Based on the income received, he plans to expand his business, and thereby improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has 4 children. She has received no formal education. She sells cooking pots in Ebubonko near Abura, which she has done for the past 2 years. She uses her income to support herself and her children. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more cooking pots to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to increase her capital base to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking pots to sell.

loans.name: Yeni Edelmira

texts.es: Yeni, tiene 29 años de edad,  es casada y su esposo tiene taller de vidrieria, tiene dos hijos y vive  en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara junto a su familia. Yeni hace mas de 5 años decidió establecer su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como azúcar, harina, manteca, carne, productos de limpieza,  churros, galletas, refrescos, huevos, arroz, lácteos, embutidos, también vende aditivos para motocicleta,  achinería y otros. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 25,000 lempiras es para surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios y de las otras líneas de productos que vende como aceites y aditivos, llantas, accesorios para motocicletas y achinería. Su meta es que el negocio tenga mayor clientela y obtener ingresos para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Yeni is 29 years old and married.  He husband has a glass workshop.  She has two children, and she lives in the Nueva Frontera municipality in Santa Bárbara with her family.

Yeni decided to establish her own business over five years ago.  She sells basic needs products like sugar, flour, shortening, meat, cleaning products, churros, cookies, soft drinks, eggs, rice, dairy products, and sausages.  She also sells additives for motorcycles, knickknacks, and others.

She will use the requested loan for 25,000 lempiras to stock the store with food products.  She will also buy other lines of products that she sells like oils, additives, tires, motorcycle accessories, and knickknacks.  

Her goal is for her business to have more customers and to get income so that her children can go to school.

loans.use: to stock her business with food products, knickknacks, tires, accessories and additives for motorcycles.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Help this experienced entrepreneur expand his business!

After working in the fishing industry for twenty-five years in his home country of Ecuador, Hector moved to the United States in 2003. Using his extensive experience and wide network of contacts in the fishing industry, he began his own business of importing shrimp and fish from Ecuador to the U.S. In 2006, Hector opened Finest Shrimp Corp. Hector’s son, still living in Ecuador, has joined his father’s business and now manages the purchase and shipping inventory from abroad. Working off commission earned by the shipments, Hector has quickly developed relationships with distributors and has managed to grow his business steadily. He has begun building credit and is now striving to expand his business in order to reach more clients and break into new markets.

A loan to Finest Shrimp Corp. will allow Hector to make larger inventory purchases so he can reach his goal of becoming a nation-wide seller and distributor.

loans.use: To make larger inventory purchases

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Help Martha bring her cleaning service company to the next level!

When Martha arrived in the United States in 2008 from Colombia, she wanted to put her full efforts into building and managing something completely her own. She began Jope, a cleaning service company that works in partnership with Coverall North America, in 2009. In December 2012, Martha paid her franchise contract in full and finished paying the bills on all of her cleaning machines. She is now ready to start the next chapter for her business and has signed a new business contract with a sports and outdoors retail company in Miami.  

Martha needs a loan to hire two more employees in order to fulfill the new contract requirements and continue her business’ growth.

loans.use: To hire two additional employees needed to fulfill business contract

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married and has three children. She has received schooling through middle school. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells cassava, cooked yams, and gari in Ebubonko near Abura, which she been doing for 12 years. Maame uses her income to help support her husband in paying their family's general expenses. 

Maame will use the loan to purchase more yams, beans, rice, and cassava to make gari. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to further develop her diverse food selling businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more yams, beans, rice, and  cassava to make gari.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 21 years old and single with no children. She would like to start a small business selling elei (embellished) materials. She has two years of experience in this line of work. Rosalina needs a loan to buy cloth, rollers, paints, and a sketch board. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy paints, cloth, spray, rollers, and a sketch board.

loans.name: Caterine Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Caterine tiene 25 años, casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 2 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una populosa feria de ciudad de de El Alto, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Caterine va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Caterine enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en: Señora Caterine is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  She makes a living selling clothing from her sales stand located in a populous market in the city of El Alto.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Señora Caterine is going to use this loan to buy wholesale clothing for her business.  Her reason for soliciting the loan is her lack of capital.  Señora Caterine faces challenges to her business, such as daily competition.  She is going to use the profits to continue improving her sales stand.  Her dream for her business is to have merchandise stocked up in order to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a fishmonger in Ebubonko near Abura. Adjoa has been a fishmonger selling fish for the past two years. She has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband works at the University of Cape Coast. Adjoa is responsible for helping her husband to pay their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lalinah

texts.en:
Lalinah is married and has two children. She has received schooling through middle school level. Lalinah sells cooking ingredients in Ebubonko near Abura; she has done this work for three years now. Her husband is a driver. 

Lalinah uses her income to help her husband in paying their children's school fees. Lalinah will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of cooking ingredients to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lalinah plans to increase her capital base to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of cooking ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells corn and cassava dough, 'banku', in Ebubonko near Abura. Abena has received a middle school education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Abena has been selling banku for 10 years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of corn and cassava to make her banku recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her banku-making enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of corn and cassava to make her 'banku' recipe.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes, and cabbages to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faavae needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, a rake, and knives for her vegetable garden. Faavae will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a rake, and knives

loans.name: Aiulu

texts.en: Aiulu is a 53-year-old married woman with 5 children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu (a root vegetable), bananas, and yams to earn a living. Ailua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, an axe, and weed spray for her plantation. Aiulu will use her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, knives, an axe, and weed spray

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She would like to start a small business, sewing and designing clothes to sell at the market. To do this, Makerita needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, sewing materials, and printing materials. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, and a design board.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan  tiene como actividad  principal la elaboración de derivados lácteos, diario compra 50 litros de leche y de su propio ganado lechero produce 20  litros de leche, su laboratorio es en su casa propia, ubicado en plena avenida camino a Copacabana,   viven con su esposa que se encarga en la venta de yogurts,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de otra lechera de raza mejorada para tener mas cantidad de leche y de esta manera mejorar sus  ingresos, ya que con el anterior credito compro una y mejoro la produccion y por ende mejoraron sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Juan's primary activity is making dairy products.  Every day he buys 50 liters of milk and his own dairy cows produce 20 liters of milk.  His laboratory is in his home, located right on the route to Copacabana.  He lives with his wife who is in charge of selling yogurt.  This activity is their main source of income.

Right now, they are asking for a loan to buy another purebred dairy cow in order to have more milk and thus increase their income.  With the previous loan he bought one and it improved production, therefore increasing their income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, from the city of Samana, is one of the members having a Housing loan. This is her 7th loan which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over four years, starting with her first loan in Esperanza. Her last loan was invested in the business where she sells groceries.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Carmen lives in part of her house with her long-term partner and her only child. She started building this house long time ago, but she couldn't finish it, so now she is requesting this loan to buy cement and other construction materials to finish covering the concrete block and to build the roof. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy building materials for wall coating and roof

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3.1 Group

texts.en:
Pura is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost six years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Nuestro Progreso 3.1 (Our Progress) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received eleven loans to invest in her business.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their business loans and attending group meetings. 

Pura is living in a rural town with her long-term partner and their two children. She started building her house with her profits she saved. She took out loans with Esperanza to expand her business selling clothes. Pura will finish building her house with this loan to cover the concrete block wall and to construct the roof.

 Pura and Carmen joined to take out this Housing loan together as a group. They will support each other in this challenge. Each of them will finish building her house walls and roof. Pura and Carmen thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To purchase cement, concrete blocks and other supplies

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy items every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee, along with a refrigerator to keep cold drinks. She has been in business since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she earns money every day.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep cold drinks.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu is a 47-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu (a root vegetable), yams, and bananas to earn a living. Umu has requested a loan to buy knives, chemicals, axes, a spade, and weed killer in order to help her operate her business. She became a member of SPBD this year. Umu will spend her profits to expand her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, axes, a spade, and weed killer

loans.name: Saua

texts.en: Saua is a 46-year-old married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy knives, rakes, chemicals, weed spray and seeds. She will use her profits to extend her business and support her children's education. Saua joined SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy knives, rakes, chemicals, weed spray and seeds to help her in planting vegetables.

loans.name: Fagalele

texts.en: Fagalele is a 37-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. Fagalele has requested a loan to buy knives, chemicals, axes, spades and weed killer in order to help her operate her business. She joined SPBD year. Fagalele will spend her profits to not only extend her business but with her family activities as well.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, axes, spades and weed killer to assist her with planting.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 22-year-old woman who is single. She runs a business printing elei in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Hana has requested a loan to buy paints, brushes, materials, rollers, sketch boards, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, materials,rollers,sketch boards, etc. to assist in her elei printing.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa is a 34-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro, yams, bananas and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Leafa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a chainsaw, knives, a spade, and weed killer. She joined SBPD in 2013. With her profits, Leafa hopes to pay for her children’s school fees and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a chainsaw, knives, a spade and weed killer for her crops.

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en: Faalagi is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro, yams, bananas and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faalagi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, chainsaw, knives, spade, weed killer, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Faalagi hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, chainsaw, knives, spade, weed killer, etc.

loans.name: Basalinda

texts.en:
Basalinda is 60 years old and lives in Potungan, New Dapitan City. She is married with 5 children. 

Basalinda has a shop where she sells grocery items and soft drinks. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell. Basalida has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years.

loans.use: To purchase two boxes of grocery items and two cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and she has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Ana is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk to help  generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, including books, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), biscuits, oil, and bread. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $600.  Ana is a hard-working woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy books, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other items for her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with 2 children. She is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Betty is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and other items she needs to maintain her hogs. Betty has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 52, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Soriano, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Teresita is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store sells inexpensive items, often asking a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita purchases her inventory at wholesale prices and then sells it by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She does a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory.

Teresita dreams of expanding her business and having a peaceful and a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Concurdia

texts.en:
Concurdia is married with 4 children. Concurdia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Concudia is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. Concurdia has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed.
Concurdia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o pay for ingredients like pork, hotdogs, chicken and other condiments and seasonings needed ion her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 44 years old and married with two children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods and noodles.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.
Beverly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like spices, can goods, sugar, coffee, soap, and toothpaste.

Consolacion has been in this business for 21 years. Consolacion earns additional income from raising pigs.
Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like spices, can goods, sugar, coffee, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 56 years old. She is a widow with three children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell such as soft drinks, snack foods, soap, sugar, and spices.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell, such as soft drinks, snack foods, soap, sugar, and spices

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 51 years old and lives in Medallo. She is married with 8 children.
Alma has a shop that sells grocery items. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for a business permit and purchase additional stocks.
Alma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to pay for a business permit and purchase additional stocks of grocery items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Enrico and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Maricel sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling companies like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. The dealer orders products for the customer, who is given one month to pay for them. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, providing a profit to the dealer. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Maricel is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Maricel hopes to be a successful businesswoman and dreams of having a happy family. Each week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en: Almeda is 58 years old and lives in La Libertad. She is married with 2 children. Almeda has a shop where she sells rice. She has had this business for almost 13 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice to sell. Almeda has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en: Eleazar is 46 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He makes his living by owning and managing a farm, where he plants and harvests bananas and vegetables to sell. Eleazar has been in this business for over 3 years and earns 35,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2009. Eleazar is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He is hoping that his business will progress and expand.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erminda is 40 years old and 3 of their children are in school.

Erminda has a general store in the Philippines. Erminda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, dish washing soap, canned goods, noodles, etc..

Erminda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Erminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, dish washing soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en: Winfreda is 55 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She's had her business for over 3 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2012. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods. She hopes to improve her business and to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like soft drinks, egg, noodles, soap, milk, etc. for her general store.

Estelita has been in this business for 15 years. Estelita earns additional income from food vending and fishing.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like soft drinks, egg, noodles, soap and milk.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: María Natividad, tiene 32 años de edad, casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Ella lleva tres años de dedicarse a su propio negocio donde vende mercadería como ropa, zapatos, piñatas, novedades y útiles escolares. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita por 7,000 Lempiras lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, zapatos y útiles escolares para incrementar el inventario y sus ventas. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio cada dia para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María Natividad, age 32, is married and has two children.  She lives in the Lima municipality in Cortes.  She has had her own business for three years.  She sells merchandise like clothes, shoes, piñatas, novelty items, and school supplies.  The business is at her house, and she has a good clientele.

She will use the requested loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy clothes, shoes, and school supplies.  She will do this in order to increase her inventory and her sales.  Her plan is to make her business grow every day in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and school supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, soap, spices, and bottled water.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, soap, spices, and bottled water

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 32 years old and has two school-aged children. She owns and manages a small variety store to generate income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. She planned to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of snacks foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, soaps, soft drinks and vegetables. She is hoping that someday the business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snacks foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, soaps, soft drinks and vegetables.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 55 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zambonga Del Sur. She owns and operates farmland; planting and harvesting coconut and vegetables to sell in the local community to earn a living. She's had her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009 and now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 62 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Eufemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, shampoo, canned goods, etc. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Eufemia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. Eufemia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dona Flor

texts.en: Due to financial constraints, Dona Flor aimed to improve her variety store to generate sufficient income. She is 33 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband had planned to upgrade their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, Dona Flor is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soaps, and seasonings to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that they will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soaps, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: Genelita is 62 years old and lives in Del Pilar. She is married with four children. Genelita has a shop that sells assorted groceries, cigarettes and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan to purchase additional stock to sell. Genelita has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of groceries, five reams of cigarettes and beverages

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 30 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Julie operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. She's been with her business for over three years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Julie is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Julie hopes to improve her business and to have a better future.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old widowed woman with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in her community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over five years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month.

Josephine joined GDPMC in the year 2010. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic needs products like basic grains, shortening, and meats, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 45 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She grows and sells vegetables in the local community to earn a living and earns 1,800 PHP every month. She's had her business for over 5 years.  She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase manure to use as fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase manure to use as fertilizer.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Hard work and patience has been the guiding principle of Christina in running her retail store. Christina is 25 years of age, married with one child.
Christina aspires to improve her financial stability by increasing her sales so she can save the amount needed for the education of her child. To make all these things possible, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 12000 which will be used to increase the volumes of merchandise she offers at her location.
Christina hopes and prays that this loan amount will keep her business be more profitable. In addition, she hopes for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries such as sugar, personal hygiene items, soft drinks, milk and assorted biscuits for her retail store.

loans.name: Rency

texts.en: Rency is 44 years of age, married and has three school-aged children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she engages in selling AVON and Natasha products to generate additional income. This is her way of helping her husband in generating income. She has been in the business for almost 10 years now. Being a kind and friendly mother, she has been able to win over more customers who make orders for her products. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10000 to buy more stocks of lotions, underwear, body sprays, shampoos, colognes and nightdresses to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make the business grow and be very profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotions, underwear, body sprays, shampoos, colognes and nightdresses to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, age 45 years old, lives in Tuol Chambak Village of Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province. She is a single mother of a married child and is involved in growing seasonal plants for her primary income. She grows rice, potatoes or other crops, based on the season and the demands of the market, where she can sells her outputs for a profitable price. She has been a farmer for almost 20 years and she is able to generate approximately 10,000 riels (KHR) per day.

Due to a shortage of funds, Heng is now asking for a loan of 500,000 KHR to pay for operating costs in growing her potato plants. This loan will be sufficient working capital for Heng to start conducting her business activities in the short coming season. Her business goal is to buy and own extra farmland in order to expand the volume of her production.

loans.use: to pay for operating costs in growing her potato plants.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 53 years old and married with six children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, etc.

Glenda has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Glenda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap and noodles.

loans.name: Linilia

texts.en:
Linilia is married with seven children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. Linilia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to pay for the construction of new pigpins.

Linilia has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of new pigpins

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and married, with four children. To make a living, Isidra owns and operates a business making and serving a variety of different meals. Isidra has been in business for 10 years and earns PHP 2,500 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Isidra joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,500, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make meals.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from nipa making (woven palm mats use for house repair and construction).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Borrower Javzandulam is a 49-year-old hardworking woman who lives with her husband and two sons in the outer ger district. This area is without basic infrastructure and is on the outskirts of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her eldest son works as a packman while her other son attends a local university and their father works as a security man. 

She has supported her family by operating a small grocery store business since 2005. Currently she has 3 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Her small store is very popular in that location. During the Tsagaan Sar holiday she needs more products to sell. Therefore, Javzandulam is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT to purchase necessary products such as wood, coal etc.

loans.use: to purchase some products to sell during the holiday.

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
MaryAnn is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She lives Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages farmland, planting and harvesting watermelons for sale. She's been with her business over three years and earns 4,000PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed merchandise items for her direct selling business which resulted in a higher income. She has been in this business for twenty-three years now. She also sells religious items like rosaries, beaded necklaces and others. She is already a widow but she is being helped by her children to manage the house and generate income. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy items like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. She will also use it to buy religious items. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for items like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en: Maximina is 34 years old and still single. She sells Avon and Natasha products to generate income. She aims to improve her business and make it more profitable in order to earn sufficient income to save for her future and to finance the schooling of her younger sister. She planned to acquire more stock of her products but she did not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of colognes, body sprays, roll ons, face powders, lipsticks, underwear and footwear to sell. She is hoping that the loan will allow her to improve and strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of colognes, body sprays, roll ons, face powders, lipsticks, underwear and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hayde is 44 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Hayde has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Hayde requested a 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.  In the future, Hayde would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Nafisatu

texts.en:
Help Nafisatu expand her seamstress business.

Twenty years ago in Ghana, Nafisatu began sewing clothes for her children as a hobby. But when Nafisatu immigrated to the United States in 2002, she was faced with the question of how to provide for her children while overcoming the language barrier. She turned her hobby into a business and began making clothes to showcase at local African markets and salons. Nafisatu’s clientele has increased over the years and she is now able to provide for her family while doing what she loves, using a trade and style that she learned in her home country. She hopes to one day move her business out of her home and into her own storefront. 

This loan would help Nafisatu to buy more fabric to better serve her clients’ demand and to expand her business through marketing.

loans.use: To buy more material and for marketing

loans.name: Maliana

texts.en: Maliana is 49 years old and married with six children. She would like to start a small business, selling already made clothes in her community. In order to do this, Maliana needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, a roller, clothing materials and needles. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, clothing materials, a roller, and needles

loans.name: Rosalle

texts.en:
Rosalle is 46 years old and is married. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling flowers in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over three years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luzminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzminda is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is single with no child. 

Luzminda has a shop that sells dry goods such as slippers,school supplies, rice and corn. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan  to purchase rice and corn to sell.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of rice and five sacks of corn to sell.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a father, a public servant and an entreprenuer. He is 60 years old and married. He has three children. One has already finished school while the rest are still studying. To acquire a daily income, they sell grocery items to the people in the village. His wife is his partner in ensuring good sales from the business. He usually generates PHP 20,000 each month. 

He would like to keep increasing sales so as to get a better income.
