That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to sell in the store. Increasing sales capacity will increase income too. From this, he will earn money to pay school fees. 

Avelino hopes to keep giving good education to his children and keep extending good services to his fellows also.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to sell in the store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 36 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lorna owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns 13,000 PHP every month. 

Lorna joined GDMPC in the year 2011. Lorna is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, noodles, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Jackielyn has been in this business for one year. Jackielyn earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Jackielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jean is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy stock to sell like biscuits, soap, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like biscuits, soap, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
This is Nanie, 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruben and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nanie operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Nanie dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will have a good and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann has been farming corn for eight years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane, food vending and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home and save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angeliza

texts.en: Angeliza is 50 years old and now a widow. She lives with her three children in a rural community. As one way of earning income, she runs a small variety store in their community. She has been operating the business for almost 10 years and usually earns a profit of P 6,000 a month that she utilizes for their daily consumption and allowances of her youngest child in school. For this reason, she aims to improve the business and make it more profitable. She is asking for a small loan of P 7,000 to buy additional stocks of soaps, eggs, noodles, shampoos, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that someday her business will grow and become viable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soaps, eggs, noodles, shampoos, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, animal feeds, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Helen has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, animal feeds, canned goods, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene is 33 years old, a married guy, he lives with his family in the outer ger district of the city, which lacks basic infrastructure. 

He is specialized in the electric sector and he operates own business. He sells electric stoves by subscription and from the beginning of this winter his business became very popular. This is why he needs more electric stoves. He is very glad and proud of his business because electric stoves alleviated air pollution.  

He hopes that every family will have this electric stove, so they don't use coal during the winter.

loans.use: to purchase electric stoves from Ereen city.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Borrower Batbielg is 29 years old and lives with his two children and his wife. His spouse works doing sewing while Batbileg supports his family by doing carpentry during the summer and running a taxi business during the winter. 

This loan will be used to purchase an old car which he will use as a taxi. His daily taxi income is approximately 20-30 thousand MNT (Mongolian Tugriks).

loans.use: to run a taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife, 52, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic and is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Florife maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florife dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 46 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Mary Ann successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business raising pigs and the general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yasmeen is 30 years old ans is a very hardworking woman. She is a mother of 4 sons and 3 daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is jobless. She don't have enough finance and savings to provide education possibities to her children. 

Mrs. Yasmeen is an independent woman. By stitching clothes she fulfills the basic needs of her family. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past eight years and her clients always appreciate her work. She is the only person earning money in the family so she is interested to grow her business by purchasing a new sewing machine. 

For that Yasmeen as a member of 5-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She dreams of providing quality education to her children.

Note: In the picture Yasmeen is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses.

loans.name: Sharavdochin

texts.en:
Sharavdochin, age 43, runs a public transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After working for a public transportation company for 20 years, he decided to start a business by himself, using his own minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes, which lacks bus services. 

Sharavdochin is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase beef to sell. Each Mongolian family uses beef daily, so he hopes that his business will be very efficient and provide a way for lower-income families to buy meat.  

His children – ages 10, 15 and 19 – attend public school, while his wife works in the book section of a department store. He aims to increase his family's income by expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beef to sell to lower-income families.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 41 years old and married with six children.

Jesselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jesselyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal-selling business for five years. She also earns an income from running a general store.

Jesselyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is 59 years old and a widower with four children.

He earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sofronio is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sofronio has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, 37, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Josue and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maribel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Maribel dreams of being successful in her business and dreams of having a peaceful and a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, soap, canned goods, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Cristine has been in this business for eight years. Cristine earns additional income from raising pigs.

Cristine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, soap, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Chhit, age 40, has been dedicated to the agricultural business, growing rice for her primary source of income. She also provides milling services to local people from her own house located in the village of Tuek Nuem in the Prey Chor district. 

Being a good mother, Chhit works hard to give her family a better quality of lifestyle and educate her three dependent children. To add to her general income, Chhit’s husband works as a paid laboror in addition to supporting her at their paddy fields.

During this period, Chhit would like to buy rice for milling and sell it back to the people in her region for a profitable price. However, she has inadequate capital to do so. That’s why she is seeking financial support through HKL and Kiva to make her business possible. The loan, which amounts to KHR 5,000,000, will enable her to buy enough rice for trading purposes.

loans.use: to buy rice for trading purposes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more nipa to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa (woven palm mats) to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a widow with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 53 years old and has one child who is currently going to school.

Luzviminda has a general store business in the Philippines. Luzviminda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Luzviminda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood, paint, wax and other materials for her furniture-making business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood, paint, wax and other materials for her business

loans.name: Maxcima

texts.en:
Maxcima works hard to support five children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Maxcima requested a PHP 4800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Maxcima is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La  Sra. Ana tiene 27 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 10, 6 y 2 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra. Ana se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la zona Pampa de la Isla,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época de carnavales es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, la Sra. Ana se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Ana is 27 years old and she has three children, aged ten, six and two years.  They are of school age.  Ana makes a living selling a variety of basic, staple products, such as groceries, sweets from her small grocery store in Pampa de la Isla.  This is Ana's first loan cycle with the institution and she will use it to stock up her store, buying a variety of groceries, such as rice, pasta, flour and sugar, in bulk.  She will then be able to provide a variety of products to her customers.  She is applying for this loan in order to continue improving her business. Ana will use the profits to continue buying products and so improve her income, as this is Carnival period and there is a lot of demand.  Her wish is to have a big grocery store and to provide a better service to her customers.  Ana is happy with the opportunity provided as this is the only job that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Mr. Tserendorj is 42 years old and a married man who lives with his family in an outer 'ger' district which lacks basic infrastructure of the city. Currently, he works as plumber at a local company and his children attend college and high school. 

He is requesting a 3,600,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy a car to run a taxi business besides his current job, in order to increase his family income and live happily with his family.

loans.use: to buy a car to run a taxi business.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 25 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

Charlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Charlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 40 years old and she is married. She sells secondhand clothing to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as shirts and pants. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shoes, shoelaces and pants to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma  tiene 53 años con un hijo de 9 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales dietéticos de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial  su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona del Plan 3000,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Irma  utilizara el dinero del préstamo   para ampliar la gama de productos naturales dietéticos que vende, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Irma enfrenta retos en su negocio como mejorar su negocio en cuanto a variedad, ya que existe mucha competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de productos de nutrición, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable donde ofrezca variedad de productos naturales que ofrecer a su clientela, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Irma is 53 and has a nine-year-old son.  She sells an internationally known brand of natural dietary products from her stall in the Plan 3000 district.  This is her second loan with the institution and she will use the money to widen the range of natural dietary products which she sells.  She is applying for the loan because she does not have enough money to expand the range of goods which she offers.  Irma faces a number of challenges, such as improving her business in terms of variety so as to be able to beat her competitors, and so she plans to use the loan to buy dietary products.  Her ambition is to have a stable and profitable business and to offer her customers a variety of natural products so as to improve her income and, hence, the quality of life of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 4300 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Elizabeth is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar, sigue con la actividad de la agricultura, le fue bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo para la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, actualmente solicita el credito para la siembra de maiz y papa.
texts.en: Cesar continues with his agricultural activities. His last loan went well for him which he used to plant cassava and prepare his soil. He is now requesting a loan to plant corn and potatoes.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Yaguemar

texts.fr: Monsieur Yaguemar  est un résident du Sénégal. Il est père de famille et  évolue dans le secteur de la pêche depuis plus de 30ans.. C’est grâce  aux revenus que lui procure son  activité qu’il arrive à supporter ses charges notamment la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC, il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 600.000 francs CFA  prévu pour l’achat d’une machine Yamaha  destiné  a faire fonctionner sa pirogue. Son intention est de mieux développer son activité  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Son futur projet est d’acquérir des pirogues et des machines pour développer son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Yaguemar is a resident of Senegal. He is a father with a family and has been working in the fishing sector for over thirty years. Thanks to the revenues that his business brings in, he manages to cover his expenses, especially family expenses. A member of a U-IMCEC branch, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 600,000 francs CFA for purchasing a Yamaha engine to make his fishing boat work. His intention is to develop his business further, so as to satisfy customer demands. For the future, his plan is to acquire boats and engines for developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Marcel Noel

texts.fr: Marcel est un jeune camerounaise de 30 ans, célibataire et père de 4 enfants. il possède et gère une mini boutique de ventes de vêtements dans un quartier de la ville de puis 3 ans. Dynamique et travailleur, il a une clientèle grandissante et il voudrait tous les satisfaire. ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter des chaussures, pantalons, chemises, pull over, chemisettes etc pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et de ce pas, augmenter ses profits. Les revenus générés seront reinvestis dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marcel is a young Cameroonian, 30 years old, unmarried, and the father of four. He owns and manages a mini-store where he has been selling clothing in a district in the city for three years. Energetic and hardworking, he has a growing customer base, and he would like to satisfy them all. This loan will enable him to purchase shoes, pants, shirts, sweaters, blouses, etc. to bolster his stock of merchandise, thus increasing his profits. The profits generate will be reinvested in his business and will meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gersenia Malesca

texts.es: Gersenia, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace 13 años que ella inicio su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como carnes, granos básicos, verduras, churros, productos enlatados, refrescos, azúcar, harina, etc. También vende productos de  achinería y útiles escolares. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde sostiene a su familia. Ha decidido invertir un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios y surtir el negocio, y con una parte cubrir gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Su plan a futuro es llegar a tener su vehículo de  trabajo y hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Gersenia is 41 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Thirteen years ago, she started her own grocery business where she sells basic household products such as meat, basic grains, vegetables, donuts, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, flour, and other items. Gersenia also sells miscellaneous goods and school supplies. This business serves as a source of income for sustaining her family.

Gersenia decided to invest a loan of 15,000 HNL in the purchase of food products to restock her business. Part of the loan will also be used to cover her children’s school expenses. Her future plans include acquiring a vehicle for her work and making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store and to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Revelinda

texts.en:
Revelinda is a hard-working woman.  She is from the village of Sto. Domingo Echague.  Revelinda is 44 years old.  She is married and has three children. Her husband works as construction worker. They both work hard in order to have a greater income.

Revelinda plans to buy a new wheel and chain, and to change the oil and sprocket of her tricycle, but the capital intended for her transportation business is no longer enough. With regards to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP30,000.  She hopes to get this loan amount so she can ensure the safety of her passengers. Revelinda believes that the smooth flow of her transportation business will continue to improve so she can earn a better income for her family's basic necessities and emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel and chain, and to change the  oil and sprocket of her tricycle

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

Rizalie requested a 28,500 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her ice cream business.

She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rizalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her ice cream business

loans.name: Tirta Nadi Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by the stakeholder in her village. They are interested in the pig breeder loan from MUK. 

The Tirta Nadi group has ten members, all woman. The members of the group are farmers. They work on their land or other people's land and get income from that. To improve their income, beside what comes from their husband, they want to run businesses at home.

Ni Komang, head of the Tirta Nadi, has two children. The first child is still in elementary school and the second is a toddler. Her husband works as a vegetable farmer. Ni Komang already has local pigs, but to improve her business she needs a loan to buy superior piglets. She will use the loan to purchase three pigs and also some feed. She maintains pigs for fattening. 

Ni Komang hopes the business can run smoothly, away from diseases and that she will earn a profit.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and additional feed

loans.name: Serigne Mor Sylla

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne  Mor Sylla habite au  Sénégal. C’est un père de famille qui s’active dans le domaine du transport. Il est charretier et n même  temps fait du commerce. Il vend du  mil, de l’aliment de bétail, du mais et autres produits locaux. Il a une expérience de 02 ans dans son  activité commerciale. Il est sociétaire dans  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 250.000 francs CFA. Son objectif est de développer son activité  de  commerce à travers une augmentation de son stock de produit. Ainsi, il pourra diversifier les  produits qu’il offre à sa clientèle en démarrant la vente de balais et de karkadé. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux supporter la dépense quotidienne de son foyer ainsi que les paiements de facture. Aussi  avec l’augmentation de ses revenus il envisage d’améliorer l  les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Il aspire à devenir un grand commerçant dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne Mor Sylla lives in Senegal. He is a father with a family and is active in the transportation domain. He is a cart driver, and he works in commerce at the same time. He sells millet, animal feed, corn, and other local products. He has two years of experience in this commerce business. He is a partner at a U-IMCEC branch, where he is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA. His goal is to develop his commerce through increasing his stock of products. Thus, he will be able to diversify the products he offers to his customers while selling brooms and karkadé (products made with dried hibiscus flowers). 

Increasing his profits will enable him to do better in covering his home's day-to-day expenses, as well as paying the bills. Also, with the increased revenues, he envisions improving his family's food situation. He aspires to become a major merchant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase millet, corn, brooms, and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Jati Indah Group

texts.en:
The Jati Indah group is a women's group and has ten members. The group is located at the Jati Luwih village, Middle Bali. This is the second group in this area. The group consists of ten women who have the same business as the pig breeder. Although they already have a main job as vegetable farmers, they run the this business to increase their family income. 

Ni Wayan, as the head of the group, coordinated the group to get loans and training from MUK. They need the loan to start the business, and the training in order to improve their knowledge of pig breeding. Ni Wayan will use the loan to purchase four local pigs. She has a plan to save the profits to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase four local pigs

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Ms.Tungalag is 43 years old.  She is a married woman who has two daughters and lives with her family in an apartment. She supports her family by operating a bakery business at a local outer ger district area while her daughters both attend primary school. Her husband is a geologist at a private company. 


Tungalag is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more products to sell at her small bakery.

loans.use: to purchase bakery products such as cake, pie and others.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a long-standing client of Yehu Microfinance Trust. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. Her business is selling soft drinks, made of natural fruit juices.

Mwanahamisi is a person who has a desire to make progress and get ahead in life. She always works hard so that she can provide her family with everything they need. Her dream is to have a large business premises. She is requesting this loan to buy more fruit for making fruit juices so that she can continue working towards her dreams. She is grateful for the opportunity that Yehu Microfinance is giving her once again as she would like to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for making fruit juices

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is a businessman. Rehema is a street vendor who sells children's clothing. She has been in business for the last year. Through her and her husband's respective jobs, both contribute toward household expenses in their effort to get ahead.

Rehema is requesting a loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans and vests for children. This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans and vests for children.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 61, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and also other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a  'jeepney' speeding down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena  is married with four children. She  is 40 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Andrena  owned a small piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase feed and additional piglets.

Andrena  has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Andrena  hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Feme

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Feme works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle rentals.  Feme is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, biscuits, candies, etc., for her general store business.

Feme has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, biscuits, candies, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in a rental house in Likoni and is married. She has had a small store for the last three years. Her husband is a businessman and they have two children who attend primary school. The loan that she is requesting is to invest in the purchase of noodles, rice, sugar, and other foods for her store.

She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who with time and effort wants to move forward and be a great micro-entrepreneur. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving, and the loan will be of much help.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, and other foods for her store.

loans.name: Amie Jane

texts.en:
Amie Jane is married but separated with two children. She is 27 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Amie Jane owns a small piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and  other pigs.

Amie Jane has joined PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Amie Jane hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and bigger pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 43 years old, married, and has four children aged 18, 15, 12, and 9. She owns and operates a small fish selling stall, selling a variety of fish after buying them from the fishermen. She has been doing this for two  years. She needs a loan to buy a refrigerator to store her fish and reduce the chance of spoiling. She hopes to use her profits for her children’s education. She became a member of Yehu two years ago to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store her fish

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is taking out another Kiva loan. She is a very hardworking person and she shows it every day working in her small cafe, thanks to which she gives her children everything they need.

She is requesting the loan to buy a variety of beverages, and sugar and flour. She is grateful to the Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her.  It is very important support for her because the loan is the only opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages, and sugar and flour.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 22 years old.  She is married and has two children. Angelica is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and livestock to raise.  Angelica has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and livestock to raise

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a person who very much wants to get ahead which is why she approached Yehu Microfinance to request a loan to stock her soft drink and food sales business still more. Mwanajuma has worked in her business for 10 years. She’s married and with six children; three are adults while the others still attend school. She tries to get ahead to have a better life. She’s asking for the loan to buy products such as rice, dairy products, meat, eggs, and soft drinks to better satisfy customers.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, dairy products, meat, eggs, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy superior quality piglets, build a new cage and buy feed

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Borrower Munkhtsetseg is 26 years old, married, has one daughter and lives with her family in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent. She works as a specialist at a local private company, while her husband runs a taxi. 

Munkhtsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to use for her sister's treatment fees.

loans.use: to use for her sister's treatment fees.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga  tiene 38 años y es casada con 5 hijos que son de las edades de 16, 13, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica al armado de distintas estructuras de metal en su cerrajería, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona  Alto Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dominga utilizara  este préstamo para adelanto del alquiler para su taller, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de agrandar su negocio ya que este taller es más grande que el anterior, la Sra. Dominga enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varias cerrajerías pero  esto  no es un impedimento para tener clientes, y  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando sus herramientas y negocio,  La Sra. Dominga es una persona trabajadora su deseo es crecer en su taller  e ir mejorando su negocio día a día para así generar mayores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Dominga is 38 years old and is married with 5 children who are ages 16, 13, 10, 8 and 3. She assembles different metal structures in her metal shop. Her shop is located in the Alto Pampahasi zone. This loan is her first cycle within the institution. Dominga will use this loan for rent in advance for her shop. The reason for requesting this loan is the need to enlarge her business, since this shop is larger than the previous. Dominga faces challenges in her business, which are the competition, since in this area there are various metal shops. However, this is not an obstacle to having customers, and she is going to use the profits to continue improving her tools and business. Dominga is a hardworking person and her dream is to grow her business and to continue improving the business day by day to generate better profits to support her family.

loans.use: to rent in advance

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 46 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lerma has been farming rice for 26 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

Lerma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and pay for the laborers’ salaries.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and pay for the laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is requesting another Kiva loan amounting to Kshs 30,000 to establish a poultry business. With the loan, she wants to buy food for her chickens. 

In the future, Khadija would like to save enough money to finish the education of her children who are currently attending school.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.
